book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.name: Brewing & Effects
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.another_:
Amount-based drops, such as when using [#](449900)Fortune[#]() to mine ores, [#](449900)Looting[#]() to kill mobs, resulted in a much higher amount.\
Each level of Another Roll increases the chances of getting the highest possible amount.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.ascensio: It felt like something that I can only describe, as a call from the heavens. A glorious, gathering of forces before [#](449900)Divinity[#]() kicks in.

I received major buffs to all major attributes.\
But I fear a terrible, ([close to](entry://creating_life/hardcore_revival)) irreversible cost, should I still die.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.deadly_p: Normally, poison was something I had to watch out for, but there was never a chance of being carried away by it. This more potent variety, on the other hand, *seems* to be out for my life. Scary stuff!
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.effect_p: When I get other status effects, while this is active, they last longer.
Instead, when you get a level of Effect Prolonging, additional levels are stacked on top of existing levels, increasing the potency of the effect rather than resetting it's duration.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.frenzy.p: My damage, attack speed, movement speed and knockback resistance were buffed with each kill. The higher the level of the effect, the higher the buff. But when I failed to get a kill in 10 seconds, I would get a debuff instead.
Instead, when you get a level of Frenzy, additional levels are stacked on top of existing levels, increasing the potency of the effect rather than resetting it's duration.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.immunity: [#](449900)Removed all negative status effects[#]() and prevented me from getting any new ones, as long as Immunity was active
Some singular effects seem to be powerful enough to bypass this immunity, though.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.lava_gli: [#](449900)Increased my movement speed and visibility in Lava[#]() with each level.

However, it did **NOT** protect me from damage by fire or lava.\
\
*Cries out for a slapstick sketch at my expense one day, doesn't it?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.life_dra:
Life Drain is a horrible thing that turned my stomach around the first time I had it.\
It slowly [#](449900)lowered my maximum hit points[#](), leaving me very vulnerable even to even minor hits.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.lightwei:
[#](449900)Made me a bit lighter[#]() with each level, allowing me to jump further and fall slower.\
High levels even made me take [#](449900)no more fall damage[#]().
[#](449900)Made me heavier[#]() with each level, making me take increased fall damage. I could not even make long jumps anymore. *Is that how I will feel every day in 30 years?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.magic_an: [#](449900)Reduced incoming magic damage[#]() by 1 point per level. While minor damage was less dangerous to me, big hits still very much posed a threat.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.potion_w:
\
I was able to replicate all the potions I could do with the Brewing Stand and more! (though some of them are easier or harder to get enhanced effects from). I can use [Reagents](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_reagents) to tinker with their effects.
I can make those using the same ingredients as I would in the [#](bb00bb)Brewing Stand[#]().
Adding a Fermented Spider Eye will change the effect to **Mining Fatigue** instead.
Adding a Fermented Spider Eye will change the effect to **Hunger** instead.
Adding a Fermented Spider Eye will change the effect to **Bad Luck** instead.

As the name implies, I designed the [Potion Workshop](entry://brewing/potion_workshop) around the creation of powerful potions.\
But with the help of all of the filigree and granular adjustable switches and valves I found great utility in it for creating other things with it, as well!\
All of those recipes do not require [Reagents](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_reagents).
Will consume 10 XP from the [#](bb00bb)Knowledge Gem[#]().
Will consume 100 XP from the [#](bb00bb)Knowledge Gem[#]().

Instead of adding ingredients to the potion bit by bit, as in the [#](bb00bb)Brewing Stand[#](), I experimented with dissolving all the ingredients in the liquid contained in [Mermaid's Gems](entry://general/mermaids_brush) all at once and adding some of my magical collectibles as reagents.\
**Breakthrough!**\
\
Each reagent will have an unique effect on the [#](bb00bb)Potion[#]().

- the order in which I arrange the reagents will not matter.
- flat bonuses get applied first, percentage-based bonuses modify that value afterwards
- the same reagent cannot be stacked.

- creates Lingering Potions - also requires Gunpowder as a reagent
- Allows the creation of Tipped Arrows, if I supply Arrows instead of Bottles
- makes effects not show any particles
- adds a very weird taste and smell to the potion, making it unidentifiable. Also colors it completely black
- converts negative effects to equivalent positive ones
- 75%% chance to add the main effect of the Potion that was brewed before
- always adds the main effect of the Potion that was brewed before, but with -25%% potency
- dramatically increases potency at the beginning, but makes potency wear off over time quick - will not work for instant effects
- negates the duration penalty for Lingering Potions as well as for Tipped Arrows
- large boost to a random stat
- makes the potion much smoother, making it much quicker to drink

- +1 potency for positive effects
- colors the potion in a random color

- +100%% duration
- makes the Potion much slower to drink

- +100%% potency
- makes the Potion much slower to drink
- 10%% chance to add the main effect of the potion that was brewed before with +100%% potency and duration

The Potion Workshop is so much more than a [#](bb00bb)Brewing Stand[#](): my biggest change was to use the liquid I found in [Mermaid's Gems](entry://general/mermaids_brush) instead of [#](bb00bb)Blaze Powder[#](), which enabled me to [use magic items as additional reagents](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_reagents). Another great side effect is that I do not have to fill the bottles with water beforehand.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.projecti: Each level gave me a small chance of [#](449900)bouncing off incoming projectiles[#]().
Prevented me from regenerating health by natural means while also preventing me from sprinting.\n\n*A vicious cycle, should something attack me*
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.swiftnes: [#](449900)Increased my attack speed[#]() with every level.
[#](449900)Decreased my attack speed[#]() with every level instead.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.toughnes:
[#](449900)Weakened powerful attacks[#]() that hit me.\
While great against single, deadly blows, it did little against many small attacks.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.vulnerab: [#](449900)Increased incoming damage[#]() with each additional level.
Drinking this [#](449900)seems to reduce enemy spawns and aggression,[#]() scaling with level. Most creatures will even tolerate me being closer to them.
The pacifying qualities of this seem to make me substantially more vulnerable to sleep, huh.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.somnolen: Inflicts a [#](449900)strong, stupefying effect that scales with level[#](). This works on anything, myself included. On that note, this made me drowsy enough to [#](449900)sleep regardless of time or conditions,[#]() which could be very useful!
This brew is a work of elemental night alchemy and works off of velvet magic. It is thus affected by the mental constitution of the afflicted, and in my own case, sleep resistance.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.eternal_: I don't even know what I was expecting here. This is [#](449900)a stronger, and oft unending,[#]() sibling to [Somnolence](entry://brewing/effects/somnolence). It hits a lot harder and will *not* end on its own save for the most mentally stalwart of creatures (aka not me!). Though it does not share the ability to sleep through the day - I just get this dream-like haze...
This brew is a work of elemental night alchemy and works off of velvet magic. It is thus affected by the mental constitution of the afflicted, and in my own case, sleep resistance.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.fatal_sl: [#](449900)Induces instant death if the effect is allowed to run its course.[#]() While I was at the verge of passing on, I saw something. A bottomless sea, a bottomless dream; faint shards of light shimmered amidst the velvet - almost a silver thread, luring me deeper down.... I knew better than to follow.

This is a great work of night alchemy, latent with fundamental velvet magic. It is thus affected by mental constitution and sleep resistance.\
\
Though only beings of immense power could resist calm waters.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.sleep.pa: Reflecting upon these night potions, it has quickly become evident that a variety of things can affect how vulnerable I am to them. As for others... the main factor is a blend of their mental constitution and biology. Arthropods are fairly resistant due to not really sleeping, whereas the restless Undead seem terribly vulnerable to it. Beings of pure will would probably be near-immune.

As I've learned more about this branch of alchemy, I've become concerned; I feel as if the tides of slumber threaten to swallow me whole. It was a bit odd seeing multiple effects being of one essence, but I brushed it off as nothing special. Now I am not so sure. These Burgeons and their Nectar, and [Fatal Slumber](entry://brewing/effects/fatal_slumber) and its traces of light... there is an air to it, one concerningly reminiscent of [Divinity](entry://brewing/effects/divinity).
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.de:
Not only did my last experiment fail, but it was also quite a pain to get rid of.\
Just in case things ever get out of hand again, I created this modified version. This time, though, it's for healing rather than flooding my base.\
It definitely doesn't hurt to have a bottle with me.
Gets rid of 99%% of all self-replicating microorganisms.
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.eg: We were at Frankenstein, correct? I have a *crazy* idea... but aren't those always the best?
What would my new creation like to eat? It's relevant, for... [reasons](entry://creating_life/memories).
What a wondrous creature. Able to be [#](449900)sheared[#]() and [#](449900)milked[#](), while also [#](449900)laying eggs[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.fa:
It was not long before the idea for a biological blueprint plan came to me. Those new materials I collected were a great inspiration.\
\
The organism I ended up with is weak, but it seems that my plans to create new life were successful, at least in principle! Granted, it is only a clump of micro-organisms, but they *are* alive!
Every living being basically has the same goals: eat & reproduce.[#]() So... what do these weak creatures eat to reproduce? Other blocks? Definitely something easily digestible.

The answer seemed to be organics! Easily digestible indeed. Quite of obvious in retrospect...\
When digested by the organism, they created an interesting side by-product which I called Vegetal, representing the **raw energy of nature**.\
\
I am sure it will be very useful to me down the line.

I'd be lying if I said that I wasn't gripped by ambition. These are my first big leaps towards changing the world, I can feel it!\
Empowered by the potent [Onyx](entry://general/onyx_shards)[#]() and [Stratine](entry://general/stratine)[#](), this second organism I have created is clearly... more active than the last creation.\
**And definitely hungrier.\
MUCH hungrier.**
Perhaps one of the toughest materials I know will satisfy their hunger?

The Obsidian was literally pulverized. Now that's power!\
\
The result was this sturdy reagent.\
Very powerful.\
Great success.\
But I am not at my limit yet.
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.ha:
I have made a discovery. The universe seems to be much kinder to me than anything else around me. Whenever I have blacked out from too much damage, I have always woken up healthy and fit again, as if I had been given new life. Though what if I can't always cheat death?\
I've come up with a failsafe in case things ever go horribly wrong.
To revive a player that died in [#](449900)Hardcore[#](), I will need [#](bb00bb)their personal Player Head[#](), a hefty sum of resources and a bit of time.
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.ki:
Those grand skeletons that dot the depths... even in death, the dragons carry so much might and life to them, there must be some way to restore their splendor through these [Dragonbone Chunks](entry://creating_life/dragonbone@dragonbone_chunks)[#]().\
\
Maybe I can become the one to restore the age of divine dragons?
*My own personal fierce dragon. This will be great.*

*So much for my plans for a personal Jurassic Park. Perhaps a petting zoo would be more appropriate?*\
\
The result is definitely not quite as... fierce... as I imagined. Normally I'd say I'm used to failure by now, but with this result who am I to complain?
Their down looks more than soft. *Maybe if I sneak up on one with [Shears](item://minecraft:shears), I can cut off a feather or two?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.me:
Thanks to the [Spirit Instiller](entry://creating_life/spirit_instiller), I was finally able to breathe new life into a once dead creature!\
It will materialise in an ethereal form at first, which I called a *Memory*.

To remember a creature's memory, I need its [Head](entry://creating_life/mob_heads), as well as its most beloved item and [Vegetal](entry://general/vegetal) as a bonding agent.\
Using [Neolith](entry://general/neolith) seems to completely overwhelm the creature's energies, rendering the resulting Memory unrecognizable, until the memory manifests.

Memories take a certain amount of time to manifest, almost like an egg: I have to place it down and wait. Depending on the creature, it can be fairly quick, or it can take forever.\
\
*Placing Memories on certain blocks seems to speed up the process or stop it altogether.*
Thanks to my vast knowledge, I can now resurrect even powerful creatures, such as Ender Dragons, Withers and Wardens.
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.mo:
By using the [Treasure Hunter](entry://enchanting/enchantments/treasure_hunter) enchantment I was able to get a Mob Head.\
\
While they make for a nice display on my wall, they also still inherit a small spark of the creature's existence.
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.ru:
This is it: the perfection of my formula. One small failure definitely could not stop me.\
This may be the one thing aggressive enough to destroy even some materials I had previously deemed unbreakable.\
I won't even make it subtle. This stuff is [#](ff0000)NASTY[#]() by design, I didn't call it that for the fun of it.

Something tells me that if I'm not careful, I could ruin this world.\
A necessary sacrifice, really.
Even Bedrock was not strong enough to withstand your newly created "life".  It burst through Bedrock like dandelions through concrete.

Note to myself: Should I be reading my old notes here while some of that stuff is still out there, I should change that as soon as possible, or I *might* regret it.\
\
Luckily I've already invented a [suitable counteragent](entry://general/decay_away).
The chunks of Bedrock are so sturdy, that a normal Crafting Table can't handle them. But my [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) handles them no problem.
These seem so sturdy that not even a Wither would be able to break through them.
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.sp:
My new [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance) enchantment finally allowed me to get Spawners to drop. Look what I got here!\
While I haven't yet figured out how to make these constructs myself, I'm starting to feel comfortable altering their properties in my favor, thanks to the [Spirit Instiller](entry://creating_life/spirit_instiller).\
*This gon be gud.*
Based on my way of [remembering Memories](entry://creating_life/memories) I can change the Spawners creature association, making it spew out another type of creature altogether.
Increases the number of creatures summoned with each spawn cycle.
Lowers both min and max spawn delay.

Spawners seem to naturally stop spawning creatures when there are a lot of them around. Almost as if they want to give you a chance. *Pathetic, isn't it? As if I needed that.*\
This modification increases the number of creatures that are allowed to be near the Spawner.
Increases the distance I can be away from a spawner and it still works.

With all the knowledge I gathered, I created the **Spirit Instiller**. I specifically designed it to combine the energies of two items, with the help of a third object to bind them.\
\
An almost spiritual process, hence the name.
Like the others, the Spirit Instiller needs a focus structure to work. To rotate the structure hologram in the direction I want it to go, I am able click on the Spirit Instiller when it is placed.

Dimensions: 8x9x5 blocks\
It can be enhanced by placing [Upgrades](entry://magical_blocks/upgrades)[#]() on the two [#](bb00bb)Onyx Chiseled Blocks[#]().

- 1 Spirit Instiller
- 2 Item Bowls
- 2 Notched Polished Blocks
- 2 Chiseled Polished Blocks
- 2 Onyx Chiseled Blocks
- 6 Polished Pillars
- 17 Polished Slabs
- 41 Polished Blocks
- 2 Gemstone Chimes
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.name: Painter's Cuisine
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.aloe.pag: These drought-loving plants can grow almost anywhere. Ironically, as hardy as they are, they seem unable to cope with too much light or nutrient-rich soil. Down there, there was just no reason to adapt, I guess.

I can easily break off individual leaves. They retain a lot of moisture and are quite nutritious.\
Planted, they will grow into a full new plant over time.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.amaranth: Although they seem to have been left behind for quite some time, these seeds still look very much alive. I wonder what they will become when they grow.

I have never seen anything like it. Such an intense red. So expressive! They really spark my inspiration.\
\
These bushels can be crushed to get more grains or planted on grass as a decorative feature or in a flower pot.
The taste of Amaranth is as different from Wheat as its appearance. In my mind, completely new ideas sprang up, like this deliciousness here.

Small but fine pastry filled with cream.\
\
*Perfect with tea.*

This feast is guaranteed to fill my belly for a long time.\
\
*Full of fat and meat and wine and warp!*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.blood_or:
[Blood Orchid](entry://general/blood_orchids) extracts have an intense effect when consumed: they can put the creature into a [#](449900)Frenzy[#]().\
Damage, attack speed, movement speed and knockback resistance are buffed with each kill. The higher the level of the effect, the greater the buff. Not scoring a kill in 10 seconds will apply a debuff instead.

Rather than resetting the duration, applying another [#](449900)Frenzy[#]() effect will instead increase its potency.\
\
To get the most out of the effect, I should apply a long duration effect first, then stack up with shorter, but more potent ones.
I managed to extract the active ingredient of a Blood Orchid Petal into a thick solution. It almost smells like rose water, but its effect is definitely... *a little more effervescent*.
The [#](449900)Frenzy[#]() effect you may get starts low, but lasts a bit longer.
The [#](449900)Frenzy[#]() effect you may get is relatively short, but starts off quite powerful.
A truly nasty brew. It tastes exactly as you would expect.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.brewers_: Brewers Handbook
Brewing for the Deep
*Reflection Of The Moon*

Hayo! The current state of relations between the overworld and the deep is rather poor, and sadly it seems to only be getting worse, and there's not much I can do about it.\
\
So I've have taken some of my time to collect a bunch of brewing recipes from the surface, adapt them to use ingredients found in our depths, and publish that as a gift to you all, in the hope that it will aid you.
Pink Cups

\
Heya, glass peaches are not just for empereors!\
\
We can enjoy them too! This quick and easy to follow recipe makes for a nice, creamy cup of peachy goodness - if you have any, and I understand why you don't, the sweet berries make for a great garnish!
*Do not exchange the berries out for holly ones, they are no good...*
Holly Hot Drinks

\
Those thickets of pyrite... they are I think my favorite places in the depths, there is something just so pretty about them, even considering for how dangerous just existing in them is.\
\
Regardless! While the berries of the bushes that grow there are poisonous, we can side step that...
*But if you do want to use those holly berries for something, here you go.*
Not Honey Wine

\
This not mead, you could not legally call it mead, I am obligated to clarify it is not mead.\
\
\
 So this mead is a bit of a favorite recipe of mine, it took a while to figure out how to adapt honey wine for a place that has no bees, but trust me, this genuinely outdoes the real deal.
*Not a mead, no no no.*
Heat for the Heart

\
Myceylon, that odd cinnamon-esque spice you all have down there. I am honestly really fond of the stuff, it reminds me of those long, tender nights I used to spend down there. Though like most, I associate the spice with a level of warmth and comfort, for me there is this undertone of longing...

*Burns on the way down and when it gets there too.\
\
 Great if you have someone you want to get hot and bothered.*
[Hidden Page 1]

Hi. I'm sorry I did not get more to you all, this is all I could manage to sneak in - anything passing by the mouth of the caves is closely watched, and I myself can feel the gaze of the surface emperors scorching my back. I really, really wanted to do more, but the fact that I have to use a pseudonym should reveal the state of my condition. This is all I can do. I hope it will be enough.
*This took a lot out of me to get working. Through this, you should be able to use blood orchid extract more aggressively. If worse comes to worst, it should give you an edge.*
[Hidden Page 2]

...Asteras\
I hope that this message will reach you. The state of things has only worsened since we last spoke, the nobles are still targeting you, but more worryingly.... They are preparing for war, it is clear by now. They want the Bloomstone, and they are willing to sacrifice a lot for it. Things are going to get bad, please stay safe.\
        *...I miss you.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.enchante: Almost as tough as my life.
Of course the effect is considerably weaker than that of [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Golden Apples[#](), but they still make a handy crunchy snack for medium sized trips.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.fishes.p:
Look what my last fishing trip brought ashore! It is not actually a fish, but a *crustacean*.\
\
They seem to thrive even in the [muddiest of ponds](entry://magical_blocks/mud).
A pale, large and sluggish fish that feels most at home in puddles of [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal).
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.freigeis:
As the first drop touched my lips, it already filled my body with immense might. Just the memory of it makes my hand *tremble* with tension again. That's no good.\
And yet I've never felt more powerful and alive than I did in this very moment.\
Is it really worth emptying that vial? Should I die against all odds, the price will be immense, I can feel it.

\
*Caress the one,\
 the never-fading\
Rain in your heart,\
 the tears of\
 snow-white sorrow\
Caress the one,\
 the hiding amaranth\
In a land of the daybreak*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.glisteri:
I came to know [Jade Vines](entry://general/jade_vines)[#]() for their regenerative properties, similar to [#](bb00bb)Glistering Melons[#](). Coincidentally, mixing them together produces an exquisitely harmonious, sweet taste.\
\
Temporarily grants a small health boost.
*Note so self: don't even think about drinking that with milk!*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.imbrifer:
Welcome. Lets not get caught up with introductions - you're here because you want to learn how to cook, I can teach you. I studied in the Meriloux Culinary College, the finest culinary institution in the deep; I trained under the mentorship of Imperial Chef Aeverstrone, catering for the [#](ff3d71)scarlet moon bloodline[#](); I, with a team of my own apprentices, brought Imbrifer its first full-lotus restaurant. \
\
*Follow my lead and I'll teach you true taste.*

\
Everybody has to start somewhere, and for my students, this is that somewhere. Crawfish Cocktails are deceiving, they seem simple, but to truly master them takes finesse and practice. It is possible to flambé the peaches and spices to make a sweet, syrupy, spicy sauce without cooking the crawfish, but it demands an immense amount of care. I use this to filter new students.

*It can take hundreds of tries to get it right the first time.\
\
Many will crack before that.*

\
Bagnun is a culinary school classic. A heavily spiced, luxurious soup cut by a dollop of fresh cream; the contrast of scarlet, peppery soup and refreshing pearly cream makes a feast for the eyes and tongue alike. There was a woman I used to know of melochites. She loved a soup not too dissimilar to this one. We used to be good friends long ago, she called me egocentric.

\
The various plants of the Jade genus are generally desirable.\
\
Their bulbs in particular are highly sought after, being alike onions in texture, but more delicate, sweet and ethereal in taste, earning them the moniker of truffles of the deep. This recipe makes use of a modern crossbreed of two native species - the striking [Jade Vine](entry://general/jade_vines)[#]().

*I've heard Jade Vine nectar has restorative properties...\
\
what a curious crossbreed.*

\
If anyone tells you that you need to cook fishcake, they're not just wrong, but also stupid. The proper way to prepare fishcake is to first spice and paste your fish, then let it ferment in a bath of nephrite vinegar for at least 72 hours. This will not just kill any parasites in the fish, but also cure the cake, giving it its signature pink color.
*The finest fishcake cures for months, if not years.*

\
I am not a brewer, and thus I cannot give much past the ingredients for Aqua Regia.\
\
But I can note that, for the good chef, it is essential to understand your ingredients and how they are made. You cannot judge quality if you do not know how quality is created.
*Know your ingredients, learn them, understand them.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.imperial:
*Chef Aeverstrone of the\
     Scarlet Moon Court*

Hello young one! I hope you've come to share in this little old man's love for cooking.\
\
To introduce myself, I am Aeverstrone of Kurivinda, and I have served the [#](ff3d71)scarlet moon court[#]() for the last 80 years, serving as head imperial chef, though nowadays I mostly personally cook for the imperial family. Do forgive me if I digress a bit throughout this book, having been around for over 170 years gives you a lot to reminisce over!

\
Emperors and peaches, they are practically inseparable! Those nephrite trees that grow in these regions did not originate here, rather, they are endemic to a land far beyond this one, deep to the east. The love my Emperors have for glass peaches is so great that they've brought them everywhere they've gone - you could map out where they've reigned just by following the nephrite blossoms!
*The Shura have gold, graceless humans have purple, but for us? The color of royalty is pink! Hahahah!*

\
This dish of lizard meat braised in wine and petals is a delicacy, and one that I would not blame you if you got it wrong the first 2 or 20 times you cooked it. To this day it ramains one of the difficult dishes I cook regularly, it is a protracted process involving many delicate ingredients. But the result is something truly wonderful.
*Honestly, I never remember how to spell its name.*

\
The humble Junket, variants of this sweet, glutinous snack exist in all forms, though this one is a particularly eccentric one! I honestly do not enjoy preparing these very much, extracting the oils from the petals is a long and tedious process, but the children of the court always get so excited when they see the stuff - it makes my old heart swell.

*Imperator Aava loved this when he was a wee leveret.\
\
I'm pretty sure the goober still does.*

\
I have a fun story tied to this recipe. Koi, in addition to being gorgeous creatures, make for the basis of some of the most unique and stunning imperial recipes. These recipes however often require odd and exotic ingredients, and one day we were clean out the night before a banquet. Thinking swiftly, I swapped out the ferment for [mother of moor](entry://general/fading)[#](), resulting in this flower-like dish.
*Don't let this ferment for too long or the mother is going to start eating away at the fish!*

\
Ah, wine, what a diverse and vibrant world. This recipe predates me - I know, it may surprise you to hear that there are things older than me, heh - it's a sort of desert wine, popular in my court and used in many recipes you may have seen.\
\
I'll tell you, go easy on it, this stuff hits a lot harder than you'd expect.
*Reminiscent of mead, but closer to an alcoholic nectar.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.infused_:
Fermentation is a very natural process - things take time and care. As there is never a completely controlled environment, there are a lot of variables.\
I can follow the recipe to the letter, or play around a bit. Fermentation is an Art!

- Time: It takes time for the barrel to influence the contents. Most drinks will develop more intense and even additional effects if given more time than strictly necessary
- Temperature: The hotter it is, the more of the precious contents will simply evaporate over time. This is called the angel's share

- Humidity: The more humid the air, the more water will evaporate compared to the alcohol, making the drink stronger
- Water Share: A higher ratio of ingredients to water is a fine balance, but one to be played with. A higher thickness makes the drink ferment faster, albeit at the cost of shorter duration status effects
Filling and tastes both sweet and savory. What a lovely combination.

The [Titration Barrel](entry://cuisine/titration_barrel) is capable of brewing alcoholic beverages. If you are of legal drinking age in your country, you can press the button below to unlock these recipes.\
If not don't worry - you won't miss out on anything important.
In addition to Haste it can grant a bit of Saturation, depending on how long it fermented.
Just... don't brew them too long or they will shift and end up tasting awful.
Just... don't brew them too long or they will shift and end up tasting awful.
A strong flavor, enhanced by the influence of the colored wood. Grants [#](449900)Absorption[#]() and [#](449900)Resistance[#]().
The high sugar content in honey is perfect for fermentation. The result is a strong, but still sweet drink.
Fermented apples, usually sweet and sparkling, with a slight sour note - if I do not forget to tap it soon enough.
Much stronger compared to their common counterparts. Won't go bad over time and taste glorious.
A much more fruity cider than the apple one. The glowy variety seems to ferment a bit faster, but also... makes me glow. Hmm.
Berries can also be used to make liqueur. Way more viscous, sweet and strong, but takes longer to ferment.
Only gets stronger with age. Just one question: How deadly do I want it to be today?
Only gets stronger with age. Tastes like a bar fight.

Wonderfully light in the mouth. A soft, sweet burn, which lets me forget my worries for a bit. In return, the things that worry me will forget me for a bit, too.\
\
*Tastes like walking on the moon.*
An interesting combination of all things Deeper Down. Best drunk while still hot!

My memory doesn't always work, it seems. Somehow I ended up with this bottle. Definitely got a *little* stronger than planned...\
More to disinfect than to drink.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.jade_win:
Since the [Jade Vines](entry://general/jade_vines)[#]() are notorious for their restorative properties, it's no wonder they translate perfectly when fermented.\
In contrast to the slight bitterness of the bulbs, adding a good portion of petals brings out a more floral and slightly tart flavor, complemented by earthy undertones - almost resembling wine, in their characteristic jade color.

[#](bb00bb)1 Bulb[#]() and [#](bb00bb)3 Petals[#]() for the [#](bb00bb)Bucket of Water[#]() feel like a good starting point.\
The longer the fermentation goes on, the stronger the taste gets.\
\
*A bit of [#](bb00bb)added sweetness[#]()* would do it good, I'm sure.
Adding a drop of [#](bb00bb)Moonstruck Nectar[#]() made the wine much easier to drink. The fermentation process is accelerated and negative effects are noticeably mitigated.

My latest result of fermenting wine turned out a *bit* too strong.\
Immensely bitter and slightly acidic in taste.\
While it retains some of the properties it once resembled, it seems to me to be more useful for medicine than for drinking.\
But, you know... is anyone going to stop me?
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.lucky_ro:
Will I become a pastry chef on top of my main job as an artist? These don't even look too bad (taste good too!).\
\
Composed of [Amaranth](entry://cuisine/amaranth), [#](bb00bb)Sugar[#](), [#](bb00bb)Milk[#](), and a [Four-Leafed Clover](entry://general/clover), I noticed a very special effect: I was a little bit more successful handling tools with Fortune, Looting and other random-based things.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.melochit: Melochites Cookbook Vol. 1
Melochites Cuisine
*Aunt Melaya*

Hoi nephews! Whether this is your first time perusing a cookbook, or you are a seasoned cook who has been following my tattling a while, I hope you are ready to explore some wonderful recipes with your Aunt Malaya. Together, we will delve into some gorgeous traditional recipes from my corner of the deep that I hope you will love~!\
\
  *~Mehrunes Chellaya of Melochites*
A Sweet, Woody Stew

\
Hearty, filling, and invigorating - Banyash may very well be the backbone of Melochites!\
\
This simple dish of crawfish is a bit of a favorite of mine, though the recent state of the surface has made access to sweet berries somewhat difficult. Nonetheless, it remains the choice of malachite miners for good reason!
*A sweet and savory Banyash, with notes of the woods. Made with crawfish and love~*
Hearty Roast with Beer

\
Young hare is a delicacy not just here in Melochites, but in almost any place where Dreitons roam. If you get the chance, please, *please* try using an artisanal azurte stout in this recipe. That kind of beer is only made in a sparse few areas of Melochites but trust me, hard as it may be to get, it is life changing with rabbit.
*While a malt beer is traditional, any good, artisanal brew will do*
Loaf for a Family

\
Feeding an entire group of people is no easy feat, but it is something that every mother has had to deal with on the regular, I can tell you that much myself. This meatloaf recipe has been passed down, doe to kit, in my family for generations - just thinking about how my mom used to cook it makes me tear up a bit... I hope that you will pass it down onto your own children, too.

*A lovely way to feed your own nieces and nephews...\
\
You are planning to feed a family, right?*
Stuffing Buns with Meat

*Much more suitable for a single person.\
\
Though admittedly, it is still too big to fit in me.*
Fermented Fish
*For the really freaky among you. Really takes your breath away.*
Melochites Cookbook Vol. 2
Melochites Desserts
*Aunt Melaya*

Hoi nephews! Whether this is your first time perusing a cookbook, or you are a seasoned cook that has been following my tattling a while, I hope you are ready to explore some wonderful recipes with your Aunt Malaya. Together, we will explore some wondrous dessert and drink recipes from my home region, which I hope you'll enjoy~!\
\
  *~Mehrunes Chellaya of Melochites*
Creamy Shots

\
While Melochites may be best known for the amount and quality of malachite it exports, I can tell you there is much more to this lovely place I call home. The breweries and distilleries nestled in this corner of the caves are nothing short of wonderful, and the lovely liquors they make have resulted in the creation of a lot of cocktails and drinks!
*Leaves you feeling cozy inside*
Plump and Chocolatey

\
Oh, graces, of all the wonders of the surface, I can tell you none compare to the delightful cacao and chocolate.\
\
If there were one thing that could compel me to permanently move out and up, it would be those two, they are truly wonderful, and if you disagree with me, I assure you this recipe will make change your mind.
*If there is any proof that the Shura are still watching over us and life is good, this is it.*
A Dessert Tart

\
You know, sometimes it is easy to get caught up in the details of things, in nuance and long recipe lists.\
Sometimes, simpler is better,and this lovely pastry is a prime example of that; milk, flour, butter, and sugar, that is all you need - don't let those stuck up Imbrifer gourmets tell you tell you otherwise!

*Sweet, crispy and delicate.*\
\
*Goes great with tea!*
Stuffed Treat!

\
A lot of people would say that us of Melochites are mighty eaters, and admittedly we do tend to be a bit plump.\
\
But, be honest nephew, if you lived in a place with a culinary tradition as rich as what I've shown you, wouldn't you get a bit peckish too? At any rate, I think a lot of you lovely readers appreciate my plumpness...
*A pound of eggs, a pound of sugar, a pound of flour, and a pound of cream.*
Sugar Rush

\
Believe me or not, Glass peaches are not only good with hearty food, but are also suitable for desserts. Try it out! With even more sugar than these parts already have preserved in the jar, this jam gives you a proper kick and whistles vigorously through your arteries.
*So sweet it will color your blood orange.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.myceylon:
Using an [#](bb00bb)Axe[#]() or [Multitool](entry://equipment/tools_and_armor/multitool) I was able to peel small, but unexpectedly sturdy pieces of bark off a [Noxshroom](entry://dimension/noxshroom_forest). Both unexpectedly sturdy for a mushroom and... tasty.\
\
This Myceylon, as I called it, definitely adds great a flavor to baked goods and drinks.
This drink, brewed from the [#](bb00bb)Chorus Fruit[#](), inherits - and amplifies - not only the plant's special taste, but also its unique properties.\
\
When consumed, this drink will randomly teleport me over great distances. The higher the alcohol content, the further.
*Tastes like raspberry, but there are none. Strange.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.restorat:
Is there anything more cozy than sitting by the fire on a rainy evening, sipping a cup of tea?\
Sure: killing a boss beforehand.\
\
This tea, brewed from the petals of the [Jade Vine](entry://general/jade_vines) is good for both relaxation and protection from the deadly effects of the Wither. *Convenient*
*Don't even think about drinking that with [#](bb00bb)Milk[#]()!
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.rock_can:
A stick with [#](bb00bb)Sugar[#]() on it.\
\
...wait wait wait, I found out there's more to it!\
If I place this stick so that its underside is immersed in [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal) dissolve more Sugar in the liquid, the stick will slowly turn into a sweet crunchy candy stick.
Maybe I can add more just Sugar to it? Liquid *Crystal* and all that...
[#](449900)Silk Touch[#]() retains its size for use as a fancy light, or simply for storage.

By dissolving [Gemstone Powder](entry://general/gemstone_powder) in the liquid instead of Sugar, the Rock Candy took on the typical color of the gemstone.\
\
I've always wanted to know what those taste like! Certainly seems like the healthier option compared to snorting them up my nose.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.sawblade:
These berries remind me of [#](bb00bb)Sweet Berries[#](). Unlike those, however, these are rather dry.\
Can be eaten, but have an unpleasant consistency. Better than nothing, when the going gets tough.

Harvested by shearing a Sawblade Holly Bush. Can be used as a [Potion Reagent](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_reagents@prickly_bayleaf)[#]() and in cooking.\
\
*Clearly easier to digest cooked than raw...*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.star_can:
It seems these [Shooting Stars](entry://general/stargazing) have more secrets than I previously thought, and weird ones at that.\
Baked [Stardust](entry://general/stargazing@stardust)[#]() tastes strangely refreshing - the magic made my tongue tingle as the heaven-sent candy dissolved in my mouth and I felt strangely healthier afterwards.\
Their hard, golden flesh has a few purple speckles, shimmering like star shards.\
*I have long since stopped questioning why I taste everything I come across for a long time now.*
Perhaps the speckles are the source of their restorative properties? I am left to wonder if it is possible to create a completely purple one.

Now THAT's a tasty one!\
Just touching those star-strudded strips gave me the same tubgkubg sensation as eating the whole thing before.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.suspicio:
Curiously, the combination of mushrooms and water is a perfect receptacle for all sorts of other floral notes - either rounding out the taste, or creating... very peculiar ones.\
\
Each flower has a specific effect, as if I were feeding it to a [#](449900)Brown Mooshroom[#]().
The fermentation process in colored wood makes the effect last quite a bit longer compared to [#](bb00bb)Suspicious Stew[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.tarts.pa:
Although I am not the most skilled chef, even this rudimentary one tastes great!\
\
I can additionally garnish it with various toppings to grant me [#](449900)defensive abilities[#]() for a short duration.
The classic. The only thing that would make this one even more delicious would be the tears of my enemies.

Makes me able to see and swim in Lava as if it were Water.\
However, does NOT make me immune to fire.
Allows me to swim at light speed and greatly increases my underwater mining rate.
Makes me feel well rested, like after a good night's sleep. Chases away the creatures of nightmares.
Gives me a small chance that projectiles will simply deflect off of me.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.titratio:
The idea of fermenting [food](entry://cuisine/titration_barrel@kimchi) and [drinks](entry://cuisine/infused_beverages) in [Colored Wood](entry://general/colored_trees@colored_wood) was not far to seek.\
Over time, the properties of the wood affect the contents. The results are sometimes more delicious, sometimes less delicious (though the latter could be due to my cooking skills), but always interesting.\
The barrel holds up to a stack of items and one bucket of liquid.
*Sometimes it feels like that when I blink the world has ceased to exist? Every time that happens, the barrel fermentation process seems to have progressed.*
Fermentation is not just for drinks! Made from 3 different vegetables, Kimchi is a hearty dish, best served as a side.
Takes a little time, but more efficient than just throwing the ingredients together.
Slightly fermented, it still retains the properties of [#](bb00bb)Milk[#](). Eating it will remove any status effects currently active.

A great snack. Biting off a piece is quick and even makes me feel reasonably full.\
Pleasantly sweet and fruity.
An elaborate feast of flavors that makes my mouth water just thinking about it.
Perfect for relaxing, and refreshing in the cold season.
Sweet delicacies, guaranteed to give me more than just a sugar rush - depending on the toppings.\
Made from [Jaramel](entry://general/jade_vines@jaramel), [#](449900)Gelatin[#]() & [Amaranth](entry://cuisine/amaranth).\
Even the simple one tastes great!
The classic. The only thing that would make this one even more delicious would be the tears of my enemies.
Gives random effects. Do I fancy a gamble?
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.name: Decoration
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.banne: I can use various resources and tools that I have come across directly as patterns in the Loom.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.block:
Perhaps the blocks that shielded my precious gems from external influences also absorbed some of the magical properties of the geodes themselves?\
Who knows. They definitely look pretty and make for great building blocks.

The brilliant white of Calcite is perhaps one of the brightest natural colors I've come across - very clean looking and exuding dignity. It contrasts beautifully with the dark and noble tones of Basalt.

The application of heat emphasizes their light and dark textures even more.\
When smelted, the Basalt turns almost black. They can be crafted into a wide variety of decorative blocks using the [#](bb00bb)Crafting Table[#]() or [#](bb00bb)Stone Cutter[#]().
By applying heat, all blocks can be returned to their polished state.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.color: I have finally managed to mix color properly! What could be more natural than testing out the properties of my new [Pigments](entry://general/pigment) right away? I've had enough of the normal [#](bb00bb)Redstone Lamps[#]() by now. Time to add some color!
They are surrounded by a vibrant light when activated.

One day, while wandering through a leafy cave, I noticed many petals sailing through the air.\
\
I was so enchanted by this sight that I set out to create my own, colorful variations. Beautiful, aren't they?
By choosing different Pigment I am able to color the petals in a wide range of colors.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.decos:
These two block tall ornamental stones will be a representation of my precious find.\
\
They make quite an imposing impression.
I can build them out of every gemstone I found, each one expressing the gems unique properties.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.efful:
I truly envy my [Kindlings](entry://creating_life/kindlings), spending their days covered in these fluffy, puffy feathers. Beyond soft - luxurious in both feel and color, even with the [#](f0af15)golden vibrancy[#]() flowing through them.\
I can see myself falling asleep on a cushion made from these.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.ether:
In my search for a block that would be traversable for me but doesn't ruin the look of my buildings, [Shooting Stars](entry://general/stargazing) handed me the solution on a plate.\
\
Using the intensifying power of [Onyx](entry://general/onyx_shards), I was able to strengthen mere particles to a point where they became solid.
Another handy feature of Ethereal Platforms is that they only react to living creatures. Objects, such as items, will simply pass through.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.gemst:
Having tinkered with the gems long enough, I find myself able to shape these fragile resources in the finest of ways.\
\
Slowly swaying in the breeze, the chimes sounds remind me of the beginning of my journey - the first time I set foot in a geode. I remember it well. What a time it was!
Each chime emits the soothing sound of its corresponding gemstone.
Gemstones are already slightly transparent by nature. What could be more natural than using them to make a kind of glass?
I can build them out of every gemstone I found.
When I set foot in the first geode, I was greeted by a pleasant, cozy glow. With the help of [Shimmerstone](entry://general/shimmerstone), it was easy to amplify this light to create fancy lights.
I can build them out of every gemstone I found. Both [Chiseled Calcite and Chiseled Basalt](entry://decoration/block_variants@chiseled_and_notched) will do as a base.

The [#](bb00bb)Calcite[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Basalt[#]() keep the gems energies at bay as long as they completely enclose the geode, that much is certain. Sometimes, however, the energy that has built up over the centuries seems to be so strong that it literally tears a hole into the geode.\
\
I recreated the whole thing in miniature.
I can build them out of every gemstone I found. Both [Chiseled Calcite and Chiseled Basalt](entry://decoration/block_variants@chiseled_and_notched) will do for the frame.
These things are much more efficient to create, if I can get an intact gem cluster.

The gems have an exceptionally beautiful appearance.\
However, the look of the raw clusters, as I know them from the geodes seems a little too natural for my edgier builds. As a full block, however, they are beautiful, too and fit right in.\
\
If I run out of gems at some point, I can easily break them up again.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.glowb:
I now have pigments as pure as can be. So why not make blocks with color as pure as can be!\
\
I thought about calling them [#](449900)Antiblocks[#](), but since they are indeed blocks that would be silly, wouldn't it?
Glowblocks glow from the inside so they always look the same, no matter how much light falls on their surface.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.item_:
There's always something I forget when I leave my base... perhaps placing it in this decorative bowl will serve me as a good reminder?\
*Probably not*\
\
They come as [#](bb00bb)Basalt[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Calcite[#]() variants.

The Item Bowl displays a single stack floating above it.\
Items can be clicked, or thrown into it.

I immediately took a liking to the rotating roundels in those ancient structures, so much so that I copied their design. Definitely a nice way to present or store my items.\
\
*Hopefully the patents have already expired.*
The basalt and calcite varieties I cobbled together hold up to six stacks.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.parti:
The [Shooting Star](entry://general/stargazing)[#]() I saw left a beautiful shower of particles on its way. Fascinated by this spectacle, I created the highly configurable Particle Spawner.[#]()\
\
A chimney? Rocket launching particles? Atmospheric particle rain for my Pedestal? The Particle Spawner has it all.
I can use its GUI to configure the particles to my liking and apply a [#](449900)redstone signal[#]() to start the fantastic display. Maybe I can even be inspired by more particles as I progress!
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.phant: I wanted to display my most precious posessions on my walls and so far, I've always used item frames to do this. But some of my exhibitions looked better if you didn't see the frame, so here we are!
A Phantom Frame becomes invisible as soon as an item in it.
This one has another nice touch: the item it holds is bathed in bright light, making it look even more impressive.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.radia:
I need a way to efficiently light my shelter and other structures.\
\
What could be better than using of the luminescent properties of [Shimmerstone](entry://general/shimmerstone)? The [Shimmerstone](entry://general/shimmerstone) used in its manufacture ensures that the glass glows from within.
Pretty much the opposite of [#](bb00bb)Tinted Glass[#]()?
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.shimm:
On my first nights in this wonderful world, I used to light my improvised hut with torches. As atmospheric as that was, it was also primitive.\
To get away from my dark, torch-lit past, I created lamps based on [Shimmerstone](entry://general/shimmerstone).
There are vseveral variantions, depending on which polished block I feel like using as the base.
Blackslag can be used, too, resulting in an especially dark variant.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.name: Beneath the Bedrock
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.black_:
What must have happened here to turn whole swathes of land into this dead wasteland? Some terrible accident, for sure. Whatever - or whoever - was responsible for this may have had a [similar experience to mine](entry://general/midnight_aberration)... only much more tragic.\
\
The *things* growing here - to call them plants would be an insult even to [#](bb00bb)Dead Bushes[#]() - look anything but healthy.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.blacks: A common, dark and sturdy stone that makes up much of the lower levels of the Deeper Down.
The [#](bb00bb)Blast Furnace[#]() smelts these stones faster than a [#](bb00bb)Furnace[#]().
By applying heat, all blocks can be returned to their polished state.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.crysta: Lakes of [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal) and giant [crystalline structures](entry://dimension/hummingstone) define its appearance.

The ground is covered with a small layer of soil. Not much, but more than enough to cover it with a thick carpet of moss. Unlike most other biomes, the many natural light sources in this one seem to allow for the growth of plants here, which I can also find on the surface.

Little trees, as big as they get down here. Actually more like a big bush... or giant shrub.\
*Eeeeh, details.*\
\
Their fruit isn't made of glass, but it shimmers very much as if it were. They are very tasty too!\
Eating one may give me a short burst of [Toughness](entry://brewing/effects/toughness). They can also be [fermented](entry://cuisine/infused_beverages) and [used to brew potions](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_brewing).
Imposing vines hang from the high ceiling, breaking the darkness with their light. They are very tasty and can be used as [Potion Reagent](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_reagents).
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.deep_b:
At first glance, there's not much to see here, but it's well worth a visit: ores smile at me from every corner as far as I can see (which is not far, to be honest).\
\
In some places, gigantic veins of ore crisscross this biome. A single vein will probably last me for years.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.deep_d:
Judging by the size of the dripstones , these caves must have been around since the beginning of time.\
I wonder how big the giant stalactites can get here. I've seen ones that span hundreds of blocks already.\
The ground is speckled with puddles of [#](bb00bb)Water[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.doombl: This plant has a rather... unusual way of distrubuting its seeds and scaring off predators: Its flower contains a capsule of explosive gas that pops, when disturbed. If I am not careful around this flower, for example if I tough it too rougly, I risk turning my surroundings into a burning crater.
When fully grown, I can harvest [#](bb00bb)Gunpowder[#]() from it. Breaking it without blowing it up requires [#](bb00bb)Silk Touch[#]() or [#](bb00bb)Shears[#]().

Much more aggressive than the usual [#](bb00bb)Fire[#]() ignited by [#](bb00bb)Flint & Steel[#](), the [#](bb00bb)Primordial Fire[#]() unleashed by Doomblooms seems to burn with an insatiable, searing heat. Almost as if it consumes matter and soul alike. Terrifying.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.downst:
In the deepest parts of the Deeper Down, I found this new type of stone.\
Immensely hard, even [#](bb00bb)Bedrock[#]() is a laugh compared to it.

Looks like whoever came before me was able to harvest Downstone! But only with the help of colossal, imposing drills.\
\
It seems like they used it to manufacture [#](bb00bb)Preservation Stone[#]()?
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.dragon:
Is it really dragons these giant remnants come from?\
I don't know, honestly. But judging by their size, they could very well be!\
\
Even now, these blocks are surrounded by a magical aura, protecting them from blatant mining attempts. I had a *blast* just running my fingers over their rough surface.

Damaging Dragonbone using [#](449900)Explosions[#]() seems to blow away the magical aura protecting them, finally making the blocks mineable.\
The dropped pieces still retain some of that ancient magic.
The [Cinderhearth](entry://ink/cinderhearth) is the only thing that generates enough heat to turn these bones to ash.
Most blocks can be returned to their polished form via the [Cinderhearth](entry://ink/cinderhearth).
These undemanding plants can grow almost anywhere, even on plain rock.

Lakes of [Dragonrot](entry://dimension/dragonrot) permeate the swampy thicket here.\
An unpleasant, sour smell lingers in the air.
These small plants spread over the ground like ivy. They grow in small clusters in a tuft of snapping green. When I fertilize them, they spread even further.
It's not dirt, it's not mud, it's... something - I don't know what. In any case, I sink in a little when I step on it.

It looks red-hot, like liquid fire. While it burns like hell when touched (I *had* to satisfy my curiosity...), it gives off no heat at all.\
While [Midnight Solution](entry://general/midnight_solution) appears to be destructive for the sake of change, the intent of Dragonrot seems to me to be pure and total destruction only.
Throwing in some items in seems to corrupt them the point where they turn into something else entirely.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.eraser: *Note from me to me: Don't let them overwhelm you!*

Tiny, hard-to-hit, pack-hunting spiders that inflict a variety of nasty effects when they bite me.\
\
The damn things are a real nuisance down here. I wouldn't be surprised if THEY were responsible for the downfall of civilizations.\
\
My usual approach of sword or bow doesn't help much against them, since they're too fast for that. Something that does area damage is more likely to.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.delvin:
I wouldn't have thought it possible. As I burst deeper and deeper down through the bedrock, a pitch-black portal opened up. Where does it lead? Only one way to find out.\
*Still, I can't get rid of the lump in my throat as I look down...*

A place that has not seen a single ray of sunlight for eons. A place where the sun never shines. A place shrouded in eternal darkness.\
\
What's waiting to be discovered by me down there?
There is *something* lurking in the dark for me, I am sure. Am I going mad? Is it just my nerves?
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.hummin: This very strong, blast-resistant crystal is scattered throughout the [Crystal Gardens](entry://dimension/crystal_gardens).
Amongst the crystalline blocks I found these different ones that emit a pleasant hum when triggered. I feel that *Hummingstone* makes for a fitting name.
Only the [Cinderhearth](entry://ink/cinderhearth) generates enough heat to form them. When heated, they become almost transparent.

It turns out that the beautiful sounds of the Hummingstones can build on each other until they shatter in a final anthem.\
The shattered remains never seem to stop vibrating, even in my hands, as if they retain some form of inherent energy.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.lizard:
Quarrelsome beasts, always looking for trouble.\
\
Actually, they'd be kind of cute if they weren't always trying to bite off my limbs.\
...maybe I'd better keep them behind a [#](bb00bb)Glass Pane[#]() - my extremities will thank me for it.
Not particularly tasty and quite chewy, but when I am particularly hungry it does the job.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.noxshr: A strange mixture of tree and fungus towers over this biome.
Blackslag, coverd with a thin layer of a mycelial fungus.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.abyssa:
Serpentine stalks and glowing fruit make for an awfully familiar sight. Though dimmer and leafier, it is easy to see that these hanging vines are related to glow berries.\
Given their paleness and crystalline aura, I guess that centuries of darkness and feeding on [liquid crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal) transformed them into something that feels at home in the cool twilight of the abyss.

Naturally, these vines also bear fruit, but it is weirder than I expected. What at first seemed like two berries turned out to be one singular drupe split into two large, plump lobes.\
Their flavor is complex, pungent, and aromatic; a strong sweet and nutty taste is underlined by notes of pine and musk - I think I can even taste some floral notes!

The unripe ones are astringent but good for pickling\
\
*It stopped glowing after picking it off the vine p_p*
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.noxwoo:
A type of mushroom - or is it more a tree? - which can be found all over the [Noxshroom Forest](entry://dimension/noxshroom_forest).\
They come in a variety of colors.\
\
The trunks are as firm as wood, while the caps are almost soft and squishy. The bioluminescent gills give off a pleasant glow, which makes them excelent light sources.
So good, every bite makes me giddy with joy.
Can be placed standing or hanging. If I [#](449900)Sneak[#]() I will place an alternate variant.
Sort of like [#](bb00bb)Barrels[#](), but with twice the storage space.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.preser: *True engineering excellence. But, boy, does that excellence hurt.*

High-tech machines, consisting of a reinforced shell of Basalt and Calcite, powered by an unknown source of energy that pulsates gently in the heart of these contraptions.\
\
Ready to poke holes in me as soon as I make my presence known.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.pyrite: Hard, sharp and yet surprisingly brittle. I found Pyrite all over the [Razor Edge](entry://dimension/razor_edge).
Unless [#](449900)silk touched[#](), Pyrite shatters into items, requiring me to combine it again.
Inspired by their properties, I designed many decorational blocks. I can [#](bb00bb)craft[#]() them or use the [#](bb00bb)Stonecutter[#]().

*Those sharp things are tearing me apart.*\
\
Well, my clothes, mostly. But still, point stands.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.razor_: Everything here seems to thrive on stabbing me. Not the most welcoming place to be.
Even the ground: Parched and razor-sharp from lack of light and water - hence the name.
Small mean plants that sting immensely when I make contact with them.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.shale_: A sedimentary rock consisting of, well, layered shale and clay. Pretty unspectacular, apart from being pretty to look at.
I can shape Shale Clay into many decorative blocks using [#](bb00bb)Crafting[#]() or the [#](bb00bb)Stonecutter[#]().

Polishing Shale Clay brings out a nice, grayish color.\
Though it seems to [#](449900)weather over time[#](), when exposed to the elements (direct sunlight, rain), returning its natural brownish tint.
By applying heat, all blocks can be returned to their polished state.
Looks like farmland, tastes like farmland, but is poorly suited for use as such. I can plant crops on it, but they will never grow an inch.
Incredibly soft, moist soil. Smells like earthworm.
Ever-moist farmland, with lots of nutrients. Plants thrive on it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.name: Enchanting
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.big_c:
My new magic fishing rods have the interesting property of attracting even living creatures. Why didn't my boring rods do that before? I don't know.\
With this enchantment, I can further increase my chances of catching living creatures.

Increases the chance of catching living creatures when fishing.\
\
Max Level: 3\
Applicable to Spectrum's Fishing Rods.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.

Upgrading from level I to level II is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.clove:
Every once in a while, I'm lucky enough to have an enemy drop a single rare item.\
The connection of [Clovers](entry://general/clover) to luck will allow me to increase those odds immensely.

Increased chance of getting rare loot drops, such as [#](bb00bb)Iron Ingots[#]() from Zombies.\
*May even increase my chances of getting the most valuable of all drops?*\
\
Max Level: 3\
Applicable to melee weapons.\
Mutually exclusive with Looting.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.

Upgrading from level I to level II is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.confl:
Today is the day where I put the problems I used to have enchanting my items with multiple, conflicting enchantments behind me.\
As a master of enchanting, nothing is left to my wishes now.

I can now use the Enchanter to apply enchantments that are normally mutually exclusive.\
\
*Such actions will require a LOT of experience*
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.creat:
Using [Pigment](entry://general/pigment), selected ingredients and some experience the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) enables you to add Enchantments to [#](bb00bb)regular Books[#]().\
\
While this process consumes more experience than enchanting in a common Enchanting Table you have granular control about which Enchantment you want to create.
You can also use this process to enchant your magical tools.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.curse:
Your tools with this enchantment seem to dissolve all things they mine into thin air. Broken down into the finest sand and blown away by the wind.\
\
When you want to knock half a city out of rough stone, it might even come in handy. Some things are probably a curse and a blessing at the same time.

Destroys the drops of all broken blocks.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.disar:
The Zombies I encounter every night wear a lot of valuable equipment. But when they die, it disappears never to be seen again (how exactly this works is a mystery to me).\
\
No problem if I manage to snatch it from them while they are still alive, though. Gotcha!

Small chance for mobs (and other players!) to drop their equipment on each hit.\
\
Max Level: 2\
Applicable to melee weapons.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.

Upgrading from level I to level II is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.encha:
In my search for the perfect tool, I've found that the [#](bb00bb)Enchanting Table[#]() often doesn't do my bidding. This highly modified Enchanting Table should resolve most of the issues I had with your original one.[#]()\
\
It allows me to:
- [create new Enchanted Books](entry://enchanting/creating_enchanted_books)
- [upgrade them](entry://enchanting/upgrading_enchanted_books)
- [enchant items without consuming Enchanted Books](entry://enchanting/enchanting_items)
The Enchanter needs a focus structure to work.

Dimensions: 11x11x5 blocks\
Can be enhanced by placing [Upgrades](entry://magical_blocks/upgrades) on the four Gemstone Blocks.

- 1 Enchanter
- 8 Item Bowls
- 4+ Liquid Crystal Buckets
- 4 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 8 Gemstone Lights
- 12 Polished Pillars
- 24 Polished Slabs
- 159 Polished Blocks\
\
*Enhance the Enchanter with Upgrades by placing them on the Gemstone Blocks.*

Using the Enchanter to enchant items is fairly simple:\
I need to place [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Books[#]() in the [Item Bowls](entry://decoration/item_bowl) and the item I want to enchant on the Enchanter itself.\
\
Unlike normal enchanting, this will not consume my books - but will require a much greater amo greater amount of experience in exchange.
I can provide a steady stream of experience via [Knowledge Gem](entry://enchanting/knowledge_gem).

To create new [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Books[#]()I need to place the [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Book(s)[#]() I want to copy in the [Item Bowls](entry://decoration/item_bowl) and a [#](bb00bb)simple Book[#]() on the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter).\
\
Because of the mundane nature of the books this will require a lot of experience, though.

In most cases I estimate the cost to be **between 50 and 200 experience in most cases per enchantment**.\
Other factors affect this, too: how rare the enchantment is, its level and how well the target item can absorb enchantments.\
Interferences, such as enchantments that do not fit my target, will add to this cost.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.exube:
That fancy book table of mine, while useful, more or less swallows every bit of experience as soon as I gain it. Satisfying its never-ending hunger to supply my ever-expanding list of enchanted tools is a monumental task.\
\
Squeezing the last bit of experience out of my opponents will help a lot.

Increases dropped XP for actions taken with the tool, such as killing mobs, mining ore and fishing.\
\
Max Level: 5\
Applicable to melee weapons, mining tools and Spectrum's Fishing Rods.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.

Upgrading from level I to level II is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.first:
All it takes is a single well-considered hit... or so the saying must have gone.\
\
Whatever.\
On a related note, I invented First Strike! I am sure it will be of great help, especially against many weak opponents.

Greatly increased damage if the target has full life.\
\
Max Level: 2\
Applicable to melee weapons.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.

Upgrading from level I to level II is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.found:
I still remember my first days in this world, when I laboriously knocked coal out of stone to melt ore. But those days are numbered - the future is now, old me.\
\
But there is a price to pay: I will lose out on the experience I would get from smelting.

Automatically smelts broken blocks. Used on a [#](bb00bb)Fishing Rod[#]() it will set its hook on fire.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools and [#](bb00bb)Spectrum's Fishing Rods[#]().\
Mutually exclusive with Silk Touch.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.gilde: What a find! Gilded Books will serve me well as an alternative to mundane [#](bb00bb)Books[#]() in the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter).

- Being much more receptive, the enchanting process will be both faster and cheaper. They can even be used to [#](bb00bb)copy enchantments from all kinds of Items[#]() in the Item Bowls around the Enchanter onto itself!\
\
\
*All is not gold that glitters.\
These books, however, are.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.impro:
I noticed that I deal significantly more damage to enemies when I jump while attacking.\
To further improve these jump attacks, I have developed this enchantment, which increases the additional damage even more.

Additional damage when dealing crits.\
\
Max Level: 2\
Applicable to melee weapons.\
Mutually exclusive with Sharpness.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.

Upgrading from level I to level II is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.indes:
I've come this far, and yet I still have to contend with the fact that my common tools, such as [#](bb00bb)Flint and Steel[#]() tend to break if I use them too often. And I have more than my fair share of equipment that was previously too fragile to be used for long.\
Now, with some inspiration from my full armada of nearly indestructible items? No problem.

Makes a tool fully unbreakable.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to all damageable tools, with some single exceptions.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.inert:
I'd almost think this enchantment breathes a little life into my tools.\
\
Like a living creature, the tool gradually gets used to the block that I'm mining and specializes in it. The trade-off is that it becodes slower at mining other blocks when switching.

Reduced mining speed. Speed picks up with each block of the same type mined.\
\
Max Level: 3\
Applicable to mining tools.\
Mutually exclusive with Efficiency.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.

Upgrading from level I to level II is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.inexo:
I've come a long way and there are few things that can still stop me, except for the Ocean Temples with mining fatigue, slowness, mining underwater, when I am flying the air and other adverse conditions...\
\
*Hm, written out like this, that was a bit more than expected*.

Prevents mining speed slowdowns (on tools) or movement slowdowns (on chestplates).\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools and chestplates.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.inven:
If I got a [#](bb00bb)Dirt Block[#]() whenever I mined an ore and it fell right into [#](bb00bb)Lava[#](), I'd have a whole lot of [#](bb00bb)Dirt[#]().\
No idea what I would do with that much, to be honest. Give it to a friend who has just arrived here and needs shelter on his first night?\
Anyway, the dropping stuff into [#](bb00bb)Lava[#]() thing has to stop. Oh yeah, Lava! I haven't forgotten about you, [#](bb00bb)Ghast Tears[#]().

Puts broken blocks and mob drops directly into the inventory instead of dropping them onto the ground.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools, shears, weapons, bows, crossbows and Spectrum's fishing rods.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.overc:
My experience with both magic and the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) has led me to yet another new discovery:\
[#](449900)Overchanting[#]().\
\
Packing so much magical energy into a single [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Book[#]() will be expensive. *Very expensive*.

- Clovers' Favor: 3 → 6
- Disarming: 2 → 4
- Exuberance: 5 → 10
- First Strike: 2 → 5
- Improved Critical: 2 → 4
- Inertia: 2 → 5
- Tight Grip: 2 → 4
- Treasure Hunter: 3 → 5
- Sniper: 2 → 4

- Bane of Arthropods: 5 → 8
- Blast Protection: 4 → 8
- Depth Strider: 3 → 3
- Efficiency: 5 → 8
- Feather Falling: 4 → 6
- Fire Aspect: 2 → 4
- Fire Protection: 4 → 8
- Fortune: 3 → 5
- Frost Walker: 2 → 4
- Impaling: 5 → 8
- Knockback: 2 → 5
- Looting: 3 → 6
- Loyalty: 3 → 4
- Luck of the Sea: 3 → 5

- Lure: 3 → 5
- Piercing: 4 → 8
- Power: 5 → 8
- Proj. Protection: 4 → 8
- Protection: 4 → 8
- Punch: 2 → 5
- Quick Charge: 3 → 5
- Respiration: 3 → 6
- Riptide: 3 → 4
- Sharpness: 5 → 8
- Smite: 5 → 8
- Soul Speed: 3 → 4
- Sweeping Edge: 3 → 7
- Thorns: 3 → 6
- Unbreaking: 3 → 6
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.pest_:
On my way to the End I came across a huge underground structure that looked like the fortress of a civilisation that lived far before me.\
\
Although they seemed to have technology that allowed them to open a portal to another world, they definitely should have done something about their vermin problem.

Gets rid of Silverfish when breaking [#](bb00bb)Infested Blocks[#](), dropping double XP.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools.\
Mutually exclusive with Resonance.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.razin:
Even with a list of enchantments that I can barely read anymore due to its length, there are still a few blocks that escape my gaze of superiority.\
\
[#](bb00bb)Obsidian[#](), you will be getting cancelled today.

Higher mining speed the harder a block is to break.\
\
Max Level: 3\
Applicable to mining tools.\
Mutually exclusive with Fortune.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.

Upgrading from level I to level II is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.reson:
There have always been blocks that I have been very interested in, but I have never been able to carve out of the ground carefully enough to retrieve them flawlessly. I've noticed, however, that these blocks vibrate in a similar way to the gems I've been so concerned with lately.\
If I can find the right frequency, I may finally be able to hold some of those blocks in my hands.

Uses gentle vibrations to drop some blocks as-is, preserve special properties, or turns them into something else entirely.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools.\
Mutually exclusive with Silk Touch, Fortune and Pest Control.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.

The smaller gemstone buds are usually too fragile to be broken.\
\
However, with the right frequency, the small buds will break off the stone almost by themselves, as if I were using [#](449900)Silk Touch[#]().

Breaking [#](bb00bb)Ores[#]() with Resonance drops [Pure Resources](entry://ink/pure_resources) instead of Raw Ores.\
\
This would stack with Fortune... if I could somehow combine these two mutually exclusive enchantments.

Colored Leaves are stimulated to release many more [#](bb00bb)Saplings[#]().\
\
Applied to a hoe this will finally be my key to getting [Colored Saplings](entry://general/colored_trees) renewable.
