In the depths, I have come across cages that seem to spit out an endless number of enemies. What madman put them there, what purpose they serve, and whether it was worth it with the poor loot is a mystery to me. But I can certainly find some use for them. Hopefully their creator won't miss me taking a few.
This immensely sturdy stone found in underground cities can be harvested.
Sculk Shriekers retain their ability to summon the Warden.
Brushable blocks retain their loot. I can brush them at home later.

The gentle vibrations lull the silverfish hiding in the blocks.\
\
I can pack up the blocks including the Silverfish and take them with me, without them knowing what is happening to them.\
Sweet, sweet revenge.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.snipe:
Compared to the [#](bb00bb)Bow[#](), the [#](bb00bb)Crossbow[#]() leads a rather inconspicuous existence.\
\
With the Sniping Enchantment however, the crossbow becomes a deadly ranged weapon.

Increases damage, accuracy and projectile speed.\
\
Max Level: 2\
Applicable to Crossbows.\
Mutually exclusive with Multishot.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.stead:
Knowing me, I will create the perfect tool, only to have it fall into Lava five minutes later in a moment of derangement. And then there is the dimension of the Endermen, which dramatically punishes any mistakes.\
\
This new enchantment will protect my favorite tools in case of brainfart (including being thrown against a cactus).

Protects tools from damage when on the ground, even from Lava or falling into the Void.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to all tools.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.tight:
It almost seems like a fever dream when I remember being able to strike with weapons faster than I can think. Nowadays, each blow costs me so much energy that I have to pause for a moment.\
*Maybe I'm getting old.*\
\
With a few adjustments to my weapon, I can reduce this downtime somewhat.

Decreases attack cooldown.\
\
Max Level: 2\
Applicable to melee weapons.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.

Upgrading from level I to level II is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.treas: I recently completed a painting, showing a fantastic creature that has appeared in my dreams: apparently made of [#](bb00bb)Soul Sand[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Wither Skeleton Skulls[#](). I waited in a Nether Fortress for hours, trying to recreate it, only to nearly lose my own head while searching for a Wither Skeleton with a spine loose enough to drop its skull. Heads up, I never were the one to bury my head in the sand.

Then I remembered the Creepers! After being struck by lightning, they explode wich such force that they blow their enemies' heads right off their necks (worst case: mine).\
To replicate this, I came up with an enchantment using [Storm Stones](entry://general/storm_stones).\
And so Treasure Hunter was born, allowing me to collect [all kinds of Mob Heads](entry://creating_life/mob_heads).

Occasionally drops Mob Heads on kill.\
\
Max Level: 3\
Applicable to axes and melee weapons.\
Mutually exclusive with Looting.

I can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with this enchantment by surrounding the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and the other necessary materials.

Upgrading from level I to level II is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.upgra:
Enchantments and Color Magic have a lot in common. So I wasn't surprised when my first attempt to combine [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Books[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) was an instant success.[#]()\
\
Placing an [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Book[#]() on the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter), surrounding it with matching [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and providing a steady stream of experience will raise the level of the book.
Interrupting said process will stop it entirely.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.vanil:
The Enchanter is also able to create most enchantments I'm already familiar with.\
\
Those Enchantments can be upgraded to higher levels, too - using the same [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) used for creating it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.name: Equipment
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.ashen_:
The [Stratine Gem](entry://general/stratine)[#]() you set into this circlet, itself a creation of the Nether, can absorb high temperatures with ease.\
It even protects you from the blazing heat of Lava - if only for a short time.\
When paired with [#](449900)Fire Resistance[#](), you're able to swim in Lava almost as if it were Water.

- Prevents all damage from fires and hot floors
- Considerable boost in both mobility and vision when submerged in lava
- When triggered, grants you a brief shield against extreme heat
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.azure_:
The results of combining [Azurite](entry://general/azurite) with the protective properties of [Blue Pigment](entry://general/pigment@blue) really sparked your interest. The material seemed to surround itself with a transparent aura which took some effort to penetrate when you reached for the lump.\
\
*This is going to be interesting...*

A magical aura surrounding your body, shielding you from incoming damage.\
Slowly but steadily recharges up to a specific amount.\
\
Each piece of Azure Dike Equipment increases the maximum amount of protection.

- Grants you [#](495b24)4[#]() points of [#](2c2e8e)Azure Dike[#]()
- Slightly speeds up [#](2c2e8e)Azure Dike[#]() charging

- Grants you [#](495b24)6[#]() points of [#](2c2e8e)Azure Dike[#]()
- Increases [#](2c2e8e)Azure Dike[#]() recovery after a hit, making it recharge quicker

Infuse it with [Blue Ink](entry://ink/ink) in a [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker)[#]() to increase the amount of [#](2c2e8e)Azure Dike[#]() provided.\
Cheap at first, but the required energy to infuse more power into this amulet increases exponentially.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.base_t: These basic accessories are used as a base for more advanced Trinkets. All final Trinkets are created in the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine)[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.bedroc:
The strongest material you could find so far was Netherite. However, repairing [#](bb00bb)Netherite Armor[#]() had the disadvantage that it was more expensive than making the armor itself. In addition, the protection decreased with every scratch. All this is less problematic when the armor simply *cannot* be damaged.\
\
*Never wilt, stone blossom.*
The Bedrock Helmet comes with **Projectile Protection V**.
The Bedrock Chestplate comes with **Protection V**.
The Bedrock Leggings come with **Blast Protection V**.
The Bedrock Boots come with **Fire Protection V**.

Whenever you enter a new world you go about the mindless, days-long task of gathering villagers around you, turning them into zombies and healing them again, only for one of them to eventually hand you a book of [#](449900)Mending[#](). All this, just so you don't have to fix your tools.\
That's neither exciting nor species-appropriate. Now you have a much more convenient solution.
The Bedrock Pickaxe comes with **Silk Touch**.
The Bedrock Axe comes with **Efficiency VI**.
The Bedrock Shovel comes with **Efficiency VI**.
The Bedrock Sword comes with **Sharpness VI**.
The Bedrock Hoe comes with **Fortune IV**.
The Bedrock Bow comes with **Power VI**.
The Bedrock Crossbow comes with **Quick Charge IV**.
The Bedrock Shears come with **Efficiency VI**.
The Bedrock Fishing Rod comes with **Luck of the Sea IV**.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.circle:
That's it: Ascension - the ultimate buff - in wearable form.\
If your mere existence wasn't in danger every time you get hit too hard - a very expensive price to pay - you would not hesitate for a second to put it on.\
Should you really...?\
\
Of course.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.cotton:
To be able to fly like the birds has always been the dream of many people, including you.\
\
Now you have these boots. The freedom is almost overwhelming. You didn't get it quite right without a catch, but what can you do.

Small clouds form under your feet as soon as you start sprinting. Those clouds are too fuzzy to jump on, but safely levitate you in the air.\
\
There's just one kicker:\
*you better not stop sprinting high in the air*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.dreamf:
A truly exceptional weapon, it embodies the definition of "offense is the best defense."\
It is the nature of the Dreamflayer to balance forces:\
The more armored your opponent is compared to you, the more damage it will do.[#]()\
\
Sneak-Use to empower it, allowing you to slice even through the strongest armor while consuming [#](8f2121)Red Ink[#]() at an alarming rate.

Requires night on a full moon.\
\
*If you ever needed a reason to go rampage lightly clad, here it is.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.gemsto:
You had more than enough time to develop your own individual fighting style.\
To best support this style, you've designed a range of matching gear out of interesting materials.\
\
Disadvantage: The shards used in the production are kind of brittle. Therefore, this equipment has a comparatively low durability.

They can be repaired in Anvils by using [Gemstone Shards](entry://general/shards)[#]().\
\
To take advantage of their unique abilities you will need some special materials:
Gives attackers Weakness and Slowness when they hit you, letting you slip through their claws like a shadow.
Grants Absorption and Resistance when you get hit, making you a massive wall for a short duration.
Gives you a short burst of Regeneration on hit, making you get right back up, ready to strike back.
Gives a short burst of Speed and Invisibility when you get hit, giving you an opportunity to retreat. Perfect for ranged combat.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.glass_: Glass Arrows
Glass Arrows
These razor-sharp arrows deal increased damage, can be fired underwater and can pierce translucent blocks such as [#](bb00bb)Glass[#]().
Also pulls the target in your direction, ready to be dealt a deadly melee hit.
Also freezes the target, slowing them down and dealing freezing damage over time.
Also hits your foe with enormous force, knocking them far away.
Deals damage regardless of the target's invincibility frames and resets them. Deals additional damage to shields.
Explodes in an orb of pure energy, dealing damage to creatures close by.
Glass Crest Tools
Glass Crest Tools
Socketing [Moonstone Cores](entry://dimension/moonstone_cores) into your [Malachite Tools](entry://dimension/malachite_tools) grants them powerful new abilities.
Workstaff
Shoots out [#](d0d6d7)White Ink[#]() which will break blocks on impact. You can also choose from [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance) when switching enchantments.
Ultra Greatsword

Deals a chunk of its damage via [#](449900)Magic[#](), which pierces armor. Use to charge a [#](449900)ground slam[#](), knocking back everything around you. This ability scales with [#](449900)Sweeping[#]()).
Crossbow
If an arrow is loaded, you can overcharge the shot by holding sneak+use to increase your shot's accuracy, speed and damage even further.
Ferocious Bident

The result of combining a Bident and a Pocket Thunderstorm. Hurl yourself into the air and damage everything in your path, even in the driest of deserts! ...as long as you don't run out of ink (scales with the level of Riptide). *Flying isn't the problem. Landing is.*
Fractal Bident

The [#](bb00bb)Echo Shards[#]() make this Bident throw an echo of itself when thrown that shatters upon impact - the original will never leave your hand.\
\
*The fractal may be empowered with efficiency and power, improving yield and damage.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.gleami:
During your explorations you were hit by arrows again and again, only to completely miss your enemy while looking around in panic - if it hadn't already disappeared behind the next corner already.\
When you get hit, the Gleaming Pin emits a magic surge that passes through walls and attaches to nearby creatures so you can easily track them down.
Enchanting the Gleaming Pin with Sniping allows the surge to pierce even more matter, further increasing its range.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.gloves:
When you asked your neighbor what this [#](bb00bb)"Gobber"[#]() was that they were always talking about, the only answer you got was that this godlike material was "out of reach for you, little artist".\
Before they could explain to you that "out of reach" was not to be taken literally, you had already designed these gloves. Oops.

Oh, well, now that you've thought them up, you're gonna use them!\
\
Infuse them with [Light Blue Ink](entry://ink/ink) to increase the additional reach provided.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.glow_v:
What makes Glow Squids so special is them lighting your way in the darkness of the caves. As beautiful as they are, they seem to wash ashore far too often and meet their sad end there.\
You honor their clumsy glowing legacy by designing glasses that can continue guiding you in the darkness of the caves.
If you are in a dark area and have Glow Ink Sacs on you, the Glow Vision Goggles grant you the Night Vision effect.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.greate:
Works very much like its [little brother](entry://brewing/lesser_potion_pendant).\
However, this version has three chambers, each of which can be filled with a different potion - which also means it can only support effects of level I.

Use the [Potion Workshop](entry://brewing/potion_workshop) to infuse it, by placing it where the [#](bb00bb)Bottle[#]() would normally go.\
\
To clear its effect, put it in a crafting grid.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.hearts: This dainty ring has it all: with the help of a little (or a lot!) of [#](d6658f)Pink Ink[#](), it strengthens you from the inside out and grants you additional hearts.
Infuse it with [Pink Ink](entry://ink/ink) in a [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker)[#]() to increase the amount of extra hearts provided.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.jeopar:
Adrenaline does not have to be the only thing racing through your veins in a state of emergency.\
\
With every heart lost, the [Stratine Gem](entry://general/stratine)[#]() in this ring shines brighter and brighter, pulsating in the same rhythm as your racing heart - granting you an exponential damage boost.

*Tell me what you think about your situation\
Complication, aggravation*
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.lagoon:
On quiet days on your patio you could observe that marine life seems oddly attracted to the [Mermaid's Gems](entry://general/mermaids_brush)[#]() you found. Since they naturally float on water, you decided to use one as a bobber.\
\
Lo and behold, not only does it increase your success, but also has quite a few other interesting side effects...
*You wonder what you can bring to the surface?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.lesser:
Potions are handy. Carrying half an inventory of them around, however, is more than a little inconvenient.\
The Potion Pendant has a small chamber that can be filled with the effect of a potion. As long as you wear it, you will receive the effects of that potion.\
Since the potions are not ingested, the effects will only last up to level III.

Use the [Potion Workshop](entry://brewing/potion_workshop) to infuse it, by placing it where the [#](bb00bb)Bottle[#]() would normally go.\
\
To clear its effect, put it in a crafting grid.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.malach:
[Malachite](entry://dimension/malachite)[#]() as a material seems perfect for tools, best compared to [#](bb00bb)Diamond[#](), but much easier to combine with other materials.\
These combinations are where the fun begins, allowing for some uniquely intricate tools.

The perfect [Multitool](entry://equipment/tools_and_armor/multitool)[#]():\
Sneak+Use allows you to switch between [#](449900)Silk Touch[#]() and [#](449900)Fortune[#](), mining large tunnels at once and allows you to [#](449900)strip[#](), [#](449900)till[#]() and [#](449900)flatten[#]().

Its sheer size allows you to hit enemies from a greater distance.\
If you hadn't included the [Paltaeria](entry://general/paltaeria)[#](), you probably wouldn't even be able to lift it.

A true powerhouse when dealing with aquatic creatures.\
\
*It may have only two prongs compared to a [#](bb00bb)Trident[#]()*, but they are twice as pointy!*
Shoots projectiles at a higher speed and precision compared to a mundane [#](bb00bb)Crossbow[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.molten:
Orange, representing warmth, can be used to do the most interesting things.\
\
Unlike a normal [#](bb00bb)Fishing Rod[#](), this one is a lot more sturdy and is able to fish where a common rod fails.\
You wonder what you can bring to the surface?

*Caution, hot!*\
Its flaming fishing hook can burn more than just your fingers...
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.multit: Whenever you leave your home, you carry half a tool shed with you. Given the tons of stone you can carry around with you, that's almost nothing. Nevertheless, a universal tool that combines the abilities of a pickaxe, axe, shovel and hoe would suit you well.
*Not as efficient in the individual tasks, but much better than having to change tools every three seconds.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.nightf:
This small blade is too fine to inflict serious wounds, but has many sharp spikes that drill themselves into the flesh of your opponent.\
\
Infused in the [Potion Workshop](entry://brewing/potion_workshop)[#](), all struck opponents are afflicted with the effect - provided you have enough [Ink](entry://ink/ink)[#]() on you.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.omni_a:
When you came up with its name, you really meant it.\
The Omni-Accelerator is loaded with items or blocks and can shoot them at a distance.\
Blocks are placed and the poor thing that gets hit by your flying items receives its effects. All it needed was a powerful energy source in the form of a [Moonstone Core](entry://dimension/moonstone_cores)[#]().
Sharp Dripstone is not the only thing that can be used as a projectile. There are some... *interesting*... things you can do with this fun toy if you load it correctly.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.preenc:
That stupid obsidian table is very stubborn when it comes to giving you the enchantments you seek.\
Besides, you'd either have to slaughter a whole herd of cows or rob the books of a dozen villages (no wonder the inhabitants there are so stupid and only too happy to be eaten by Zombies).

The advantage of knowing exactly what you want gives you the ability to shape your tools so that they inherently possess those qualities. The magic of colors makes it possible.\
\
Unfortunately, these features make these tools very fragile for the most part.

The ends of this pickaxe are studded with Topaz to cut even the most delicate material from stone.\
Pre-enchanted with **[#](157687)Silk Touch[#]()**.

Infused with the power of [#](f0af15)energy[#](), it allows you to carve out every last bit of ore from every vein.\
Pre-enchanted with **[#](f0af15)Fortune III[#]()**.

The short, razor-sharp blade makes this item a deadly weapon - but at the cost of durability.\
Pre-enchanted with **[#](aa32a0)Looting III[#]()**.
As an outlier in the group, the Oblivion Pickaxe has a large amount of durability and mining speed. However, all mined blocks [are destroyed](entry://enchanting/enchantments/curse_of_the_void)[#]().
Matches its own gentle vibrations to those of its surroundings. [Allows you to keep blocks intact](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance) that would otherwise be irreparably destroyed.

A real Powerhouse of a Pickaxe for when you want to break hard blocks.\
Comes pre-enchanted with [Razing](entry://enchanting/enchantments/razing).
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.puff_c:
This glistening hoop creates a protective film of air around you.\
\
Grants you [#](495b24)4[#]() points of [#](2c2e8e)Azure Dike[#](). Using those charges, it not only protects you from enemy projectiles, but can even cushion a long fall.\
The Puff Circlet also prevents [#](bb00bb)Farmland[#]() from being trampled.
*Gone are the days of being sniped from behind by Skeletons.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.radian:
You didn't name the Radiance so similar to the [Radiance Staff](entry://equipment/radiance_staff) on accident.\
If you are in a dark area, the pin automatically creates an invisible light on you. Unlike the lights of the [Radiance Staff](entry://equipment/radiance_staff), however, they slowly become fainter and fainter until they eventually dissipate completely.
Fantastic to see the paths you've already taken in your cave explorations.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.ring_o: Mining is your game. It's almost a miracle that you're only now coming up with the idea of upgrading not only your tools, but your mining proficiency in general. This ring will grow with your abilities.
Infuse it with [Magenta Ink](entry://ink/ink) in a [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker)[#]() to increase your Mining Speed.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.seven_: Getting from A to B is tedious. Your travel time only seems to go up, especially with [Geodes](entry://general/geodes) scattered across the land as they are. To solve this issue, you designed the Seven League Boots, making you much more mobile than before.
Increases both Movement Speed and Step Height.
The Power enchantment increases the movement speed bonus further.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.take_o:
Climbing mountains or misshapen caves is always very time-consuming. If you don't see an option to scramble up over misshapen ledges, you have no choice but to carve a path into the rock.\
Using your new Takeoff Belt you are able to put great vertical distances behind you, saving time and sparing your beautiful nature from destruction.

Sneak to charge a high jump, getting more powerful the longer you charge.\
\
*Even if the name implies it, please don't take it off.*
The Power enchantment increases the jump height even further.

Feather Falling will grant you a short slow fall effect, allowing you to better navigate to where you want to land. A high level of Feather Falling may be a very viable way to safely descend down those cliffs again, actually.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.totem_:
[#](bb00bb)Totems of Undying[#](), while having a powerful effect, have the significant disadvantage that you always have to hold them in your hand.\
\
Using the protective powers of [Blue Pigment](entry://general/pigment@blue) as a focus you can keep its life-saving effect active, even when worn around the neck.
One-time protection from death. After it is triggered, crumbles into dust.
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.weepin:
These hostile underwater temples are hell to maneuver in. Luckily, in your search for treasure, you stumbled upon a [#](bb00bb)Heart of The Sea[#]().\
This circlet allows you to live and mine underwater as if it were the most natural thing ever. You swim and mine faster, require no air and are able to see better.\
It also heals your little close by Axolotl friends. ♥

*Have you ever wanted to live underwater?\
No? Whatever, now you can. Time to build an underwater base!*
book.spectrum.guidebook.equipment.whispy:
The bags under your eyes aren't the only evidence of your lack of sleep. There are those creatures that come haunt you straight out of your missed nightmares when you don't regularly lay down to sleep - almost like they feel cheated.\
The manifestation of relaxation, no sleep necessary.

After just a few minutes of wear, you feel physically and mentally refreshed. You also recover from negative effects more quickly.\
\
*The pleasures of a good night's sleep.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.name: Your Journey
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.anvil_cr:
*"To create something new\
you have to go the way of destruction"      - someone*

Until now you primarily used your anvil to repair and upgrade your tools. Such a heavy object as an anvil can be of much more use, though! Why not use it to crush things into dust by sheer force? Like the skulls of your enemies... or items. Yeah, that's probably better.\
\
You can use Item Crushing to crush [Gemstone Shards](entry://general/shards)[#]() into [powder](entry://general/gemstone_powder)[#]().\
\
*Tip: The further the anvil falls, the better.*
Dropping an [#](bb00bb)Anvil[#]() on some items cracks them, or turns them into different ones altogether.
You are also able to crush [#](bb00bb)flowers[#]() into [#](bb00bb)dye[#](), [#](bb00bb)Horse Armor[#]() into [#](bb00bb)ingots[#](), or increase your yield of [#](bb00bb)Blaze Powder[#]()this way.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.color_mi: By mixing [#](157687)Cyan[#](), [#](aa32a0)Magenta[#]() and [#](f0af15)Yellow[#]() (almost) any color can be created.

Your attempts to mix [Gemstone Powder](entry://general/gemstone_powder) directly have not been very successful. But now you have another idea:\
The closeness of your gemstones to nature suggests that *nature* must be both the source and the answer!\
\
You quickly scribble some notes, result being [a recipe](entry://general/colored_trees)[#](), which looks very promising.

You have tried and tried, to no avail. You could not find a way to create [#](613c20)brown[#]() by mixing your gem powder. The closest you came was a washed-out orange - ugh.\
It can't be that hard. Like... [#](613c20)Dirt is brown[#]() and it's the most common stuff around.\
\
There must be a way... \
and you're pretty sure [#](000000)Black[#]() is the answer.

\
\
\
\
\
\
\
*Seriously, look it up! The way we perceive brown is fascinating!*
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.colored_:
You need something organic to mix your pigments. In your experiments, you could see that the roots of [#](bb00bb)Saplings[#]() absorb the color of the [Gemstone Powder](entry://general/gemstone_powder)[#]() with ease. Pure Color pulses through their tiny stems and first few leaves already.\
\
How will they look like when fully grown?

Creating a Colored Sapling requires a different combination of [Gemstone Powder](entry://general/gemstone_powder)[#](), corresponding to the [amount needed to mix its color](entry://general/color_mixing).
They existed around you all along! Who knows what else is out there.
Like their non-colorful, non-magical counterparts, you can also strip the logs and use their wood for Planks, Stairs, Slabs, Buttons, Pressure Plates, Fences and Fence Gates.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.budding_:
Creating [Onyx](entry://general/onyx_shards)[#]() was always very tricky, as it depended on the current phase of the moon. Despite the [Crescent Clock](entry://equipment/crescent_clock) being a thing, you often missed that short time window.\
Making Onyx growable like the other gems will save you a huge amount of time.\
\
*Strangely, the same procedure does not seem to work for the other gems?*

Even if it seems expensive, having renewable Onyx seems worth it.\
\
Best to craft a larger batch of [Midnight Aberrations](entry://general/midnight_aberration) all at once, as they seem to crumble in your hands quickly.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.fusion_s:
To create [Black Shards](entry://general/onyx_shards)[#]() you have developed a special construction.\
You can either click or throw items and buckets onto it. You can even process entire stacks of fusion ingredients at once, making fusing much more efficient than using a single item per cycle. Very useful for recipes that require [good timing](entry://general/onyx_shards)[#]().

Can be constructed using [#](bb00bb)Calcite[#]() or [#](bb00bb)Basalt[#]().\
Requires a focus structure and clear view of the sky.

- 1 Fusion Shrine
- 4 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 4 Chiseled Polished Blocks
- 8 Polished Pillars
- 12 Polished Slabs
- 77 Polished Blocks\
\
As always you are able to switch [#](bb00bb)Basalt[#]() with [#](bb00bb)Calcite[#]() and choose the [Gemstone Blocks](entry://decoration/gemstone_storage_blocks) to your liking.

You have designed the structure for the Fusion Shrine to bundle the magical energies of [#](157687)Matter[#](), [#](aa32a0)Time[#]() and [#](f0af15)Energy[#]() and focus them on a single, central point, the Fusion Shrine itself.\
\
These powerful bundled energies seem to even have enough power to change the weather.

*It's a brand new day\
And the sun is high\
All the birds are singing\
That you're gonna die*

*Knock Knock\
Who's there?\
Accordion\
Accordion who?\
Accordion to the forecast, it's going to rain tonight.*

*Why did the god of thunder drink water?\
\
Because he was thorsty.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.gemstone:
Most recipes in your pedestal require some amount of Gemstone Powder as a source of magical energy.\
It comes in various colors and can be acquired by pulverizing [Gemstone Shards](entry://general/shards)[#]() via [Item Crushing](entry://general/item_crushing)[#]().

There is nothing more important to an upcoming artist than mixing the right paint.\
Unfortunately, you found that in the case of Gemstone Powder, it's not nearly as easy as it initially seemed. The powders don't quite want to mix, the result being just a multicolored mass.\
\
Maybe you can come up with something later?
$(item)Gemstone Powder$() can be compacted for storage or decoration.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.intro.pa: Spectrum is a progression and exploration-driven magic mod where you combine colors.

You will be tinkering with color mixing in the subtractive color system (CMYK). You may be familiar with subtractive color mixing from watercolor painting or printing.\
\
The main colors of the spectrum are represented with gemstones, you can find in geodes scattered around the world, with the vanilla Amethyst representing Magenta.

Spectrum features a unique progression system where you unlock new things as you progress.\
As you progress, you will notice changes in the world. Differences that only *you* personally can perceive.\
\
Everything you learn will bring you closer to your ultimate goal: To find out what lies beneath the impenetrable bedrock floor.

No idea on how to progress? Take a look at this book or your advancements. These give a lot of hints on what to do next. Press the bottom center arrow to get started!\
\
Spectrum is still in development. If you find a bug or have a suggestion, visit Spectrum's Discord or report them on GitHub.\
Have fun!        - DaFuqs
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.midnight:
The results of my [last experiment](entry://general/failing) make me long for more: how much power can I squeeze out of these gemstones?\
I am sure there's more, and [Neolith](entry://general/neolith) must will be my entry gate! With such coherence, it may allow me to unite the powers of all the gems into one. This relic shall be the capstone to my creation, my personal Philosopher's stone, making me a living god!

Requires daytime and a clear sky.\
\
The fusion of these magical energies will stress my Fusion Shrine like nothing before - with a display to match. Best to make sure it and the blocks around it are fortified and isolated.

*This abomination of a gemstone radiates an eerie aura.*\
\
It looks loosely connected at best. No wonder it falls apart in my hands in no time. Total failure. Diary, I am both *devastated* and disappointed in myself.

While the chaos that ensued was *definitely* not the result I craved for, the result does indeed hold immense power.\
So much so that it will crumble to dust if not used quickly.\
\
And then there is that aggressive blackish fluid that manifested in the process. Because of its color I named it [Midnight Solution](entry://general/midnight_solution).
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.moonston:
You were quite simple-minded, weren't you? Thought you knew everything, but this everything was always merely half the truth.\
\
You know better now. This white, pure gemstone you hold in your hand, shimmering in a soft, warm glow, is the monument to that.

You have never been remotely omnipotent, never will be. Not with all the magic in the world. No one is. But with a little humility, care and support, you can at least get a little closer.\
\
**[#](d0d6d7)Purity.**
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.mysterio:
You found this mysterious Locket in a Preservation Chest. It is shut tight. It features an odd ornament which resembles a notch, softly glowing a pale white color, a shimmer reminiscent of the moon.\
There seems to be something inside. It also has an engraving on its back, but if it even resembles a language it's none you have ever seen.\
What is it for? Who did it belong to? Why was it there?
The notch you noticed perfectly seems to fit a [Moonstone Core](entry://dimension/moonstone_cores)[#]().

The locket contained a small crystal, bearing a dim, yet warm glow.\
While [below the Bedrock](entry://dimension/delving_deeper_down)[#](), it softly vibrates as you turn.
There also was a small note inside... who could it have belonged to?

Now that you understand Dreiton tongue, it is easy for you to decipher the inscription on the back:\
\
*Don't be silly Asteras - the moon can't glow, it can only reflect the sun's light.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.onyx_sha:
To create brown Pigment you needed a way to darken an orange tone.\
And then it occurred to you. It's so logical when you think about it! The three gems you found correspond to the three basic colors of color theory!\
By mixing all three colors you can create a shard that is so dark it almost looks unreal.

The creation of this 'blackest of blacks' in the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine)[#]() has to be performed in a way that absolutely no unregulated light can pollute the crystal. So midnight on a new moon it is. Best to bring a clock with you.
Depending on the positions of Sun and Moon, the Moon will reflect more or less light.

These are known as [#](449900)Moon Phases[#]().\
\
When the moon is at its brightest, it is known as a [#](449900)Full Moon[#](). When at its darkest, it is a [#](449900)New Moon[#]().\
\
An entire lunar phase cycle from one new moon to the following new moon is also called a [#](449900)lunation[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.paintbru:
Why a *brush* of all things?\
\
Good question, you wondered that yourself. It was mostly intuition that brought you to this decision. There is something about the colorful Pedestal and the bright colors of the Crystals that awakens your inner artist.
Give the [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) a hearty whack with it to make it start crafting.

What better use is there for [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() than coloring with it?\
[#](449900)Crouch while having your Paintbrush equipped to bring up the color selection menu[#](). You just have to slightly touch the block you would like to color for the [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() to flow into it and convert it into its colored variant.

Now that you've discovered Ink, your brush has another function: you can bundle ink as a projectile and fling it.\
The surface (or creature!) that the projectile hits will be painted as long as the block there is able to be recolored.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.pedestal: Upgrade your [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal)[#]() by using all the shards you collected on your journey.

To make use of the [Pigment Pedestal's](entry://general/pedestal)[#]() advanced abilities you will need a structure to focus gemstone energy into it.\
\
You call it the\
**Spectrum Focus**.
Dimensions: 11x11x4 blocks. But best to leave a few additional blocks of space around, just to make sure.

- 1 Pigment Pedestal
- 4 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 4 Chiseled Polished Blocks
- 4 Notched Polished Blocks
- 8 Polished Pillars
- 68 Polished Blocks
You can switch the basalt blocks with calcite and choose the gemstone blocks as you like it best. Mix up [#](bb00bb)Calcite[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Basalt[#]() up to create your personal variation!

Your latest structure feels... somewhat lacking. And now you also know exactly what is missing: more [#](d0d6d7)Moonstone[#](). The tricky part: Creating the required [#](bb00bb)Moonstone Chiseled Blocks[#]() would require you being able to use your [#](bb00bb)Moonstone Pedestal[#]() to it's full capability already.\
*Could there be a way to get around that?*

- 1 Pigment Pedestal
- 4 Onyx Chiseled Blocks
- 4 Notched Polished Blocks
- 8 Gemstone Lights
- 4 Gemstone Chiseled Blocks
- 12 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 16 CMY Gemstone Chiseled Bl.
- 28 Moonstone Chiseled Bl.
- 36 Polished Pillars
- 52 Polished Crests
- 144 Polished Blocks
You can switch the basalt blocks with calcite and choose the gemstone blocks as you like it best. Mix up [#](bb00bb)Calcite[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Basalt[#]() up to create your personal variation!
Upgrade your [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal)[#]() by using one of your gathered [Moonstone Shards](entry://general/shards@moonstone)[#]().

- 1 Pigment Pedestal
- 4 Onyx Chiseled Blocks
- 4 Notched Polished Blocks
- 8 Gemstone Lights
- 4 Gemstone Chiseled Blocks
- 12 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 16 CMYK Chiseled Blocks
- 36 Polished Pillars
- 52 Polished Crests
- 172 Polished Blocks

- 4 Onyx Chiseled Blocks
- 4 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 36 Polished Crests
- 12 Polished Blocks
Upgrade your [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal)[#]() by using one of your [Onyx Shards](entry://general/shards@onyx)[#]() to further increase its magical powers.

- 1 Pigment Pedestal
- 8 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 8 Gemstone Lights
- 4 Chiseled Polished Blocks
- 16 Gemstone Chiseled Blocks
- 16 Polished Crests
- 4 Notched Polished Blocks
- 36 Polished Pillars
- 160 Polished Blocks

- 4 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 8 Gemstone Lights
- 16 Gemstone Chiseled Blocks
- 16 Polished Crests
- 28 Polished Pillars
- 92 Polished Blocks
You can switch the basalt blocks with calcite and choose the gemstone blocks as you like it best. Mix up [#](bb00bb)Calcite[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Basalt[#]() up to create your personal variation!

The **Pigment Pedestal** is the block where you craft most of the recipes for Spectrum.\
\
To start crafting trigger it with a [Paintbrush](entry://general/paintbrush)[#]() or supply a [#](449900)redstone signal[#]().\
It requires air or an inventory above it.

\
Most recipes require [Gemstone Powder](entry://general/gemstone_powder)[#]() as an ingredient.\
\
The Pedestal also acts as a [#](bb00bb)Crafting Table[#]() and can therefore also be used to craft vanilla recipes.\
\
You can use a [Crafting Tablet](entry://equipment/crafting_tablet)[#]() to automate both Spectrum and Vanilla recipes.

\
The Pigment Pedestal can be built with your gemstone of choice.\
\
While they do look different they are the same, functionally.
Finally! You were able to obtain absolutely pure color pigments from the leaves of [Colored Trees](entry://general/colored_trees)[#]().\
And when using a hoe harvesting them is pretty fast, too.\
These pigments, composed of their fundamentals [#](aa32a0)TIME[#](), [#](f0af15)ENERGY[#]() and [#](157687)MATTER[#](), definitely feel magical.\
\
Still not fully convinced all of these even exist. How many can you find?

The darkest material you have ever held in your hands. It looks almost surreal.\
\
[#](000000)Black[#]() represents the nothingness of the *Void*, *Power* and *Mystery*.

Holding it in your hand gives you a sign of security. Of course, all nonsense, after all, it is only a color. But still...\
\
[#](2c2e8e)Blue[#]() represents *Safety* and *Permanence*.

This rich brown makes you long for mother nature.\
\
[#](613c20)Brown[#]() represents *Nature* and *Stability*.

It makes you feel as if you are sitting on the top of a mountain, taking in the never-ending vastness of the world.\
\
[#](157687)Cyan[#]() represents *Matter* and *Integrity*.

This color looks to you like the defeated older brother of light gray. Whenever you look at it you get a little sad, but you do not know exactly why.\
\
[#](36393d)Gray[#]() represents *Evanescence*.

This pigment softly radiates inner peace.\
\
[#](495b24)Green[#]() represents *Balance* and *Harmony*.

Looking at this color, you feel a sense of optimism, but also departure.\
\
[#](258ac8)Light Blue[#]() represents *Luck* and *Peace*.

You know that feeling when you are sitting serenely, looking at the landscape, feeling life pass you by, and yet everything is okay?\
\
[#](7d7d73)Light Gray[#]() represents *Change*, but also *Quiet*.

This juicy lime almost smells like a warm spring morning. Or are you just imagining?\
\
[#](5faa19)Lime[#]() represents *Happiness* and *Fertility*.

This soft magenta puts you in a calm and content, almost serene mood.\
\
[#](aa32a0)Magenta[#]() represents *Time*, *Kindness* and *Tolerance*.

This orange color reminds you of autumn and makes you feel a bit like you are sitting in a cozy armchair in front of a fireplace.\
\
[#](e16201)Orange[#]() represents *Warmth* and *Comfort*.

This bright, lively cotton candy pink makes you beam with joy.\
\
[#](d6658f)Pink[#]() represents *Health* and *Admiration*.

This sight makes your mind go into high gear. It not only stimulates your thirst for knowledge, but also gives you creative ideas.\
\
[#](641f9c)Purple[#]() represents *Wisdom* and *Creativity*.

You feel the urge and the desire to create something beautiful.\
\
[#](8f2121)Red[#]() represents *Passion* and *Willpower*.

You can not exactly put it into words. This pigment radiates something unspeakably wonderful.\
\
[#](d0d6d7)White[#]() represents *LIFE*, *Light* and *Purity*.

The vibrant yellow is almost bursting with energy.\
\
[#](f0af15)Yellow[#]() represents *Energy* and *Joy*.
They can get crafted back into [#](bb00bb)Pigment[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.preserva:
Deep underground you found this outlandish structure, which seems to be built from immensely sturdy stone. Whoever constructed them seems to have knowledge way beyond your understanding.\
There has to be a way to get in there! If not now, then later... better keep the location in mind.

Until now you thought you were alone in your creative endeavour with the gems. From the looks of it, you were wrong. So very, very wrong.\
Whoever built these structures obviously followed a similar path as you, but was miles ahead.\
Still, anyway. You accept the challenge, of course. You have one huge advantage:\
*YOU are still alive.*
They seem to come in different variations. In each one you will encounter a different challenge.
A strong, magical force field. Wearing [Azure Dike equipment](entry://equipment/trinkets/azure_dike_equipment) allowed you to enter.
It was all so clear, in the end! You had it [all laid out already](entry://general/color_mixing).
A really weird one. Having some colors at hand helped a lot.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.shards.p:
To start delving into Spectrum you first have to find some gemstone shards.\
\
Each kind of gemstone represents an elemental color and a different kind of natural force.

Topaz Shards lie surprisingly heavy in your hand. This gemstone quickly turned out to be one of the most robust materials you've ever gotten your hands on - perhaps only surpassed by diamond. Topaz is found in geodes at the very top of steep hills and on the tops of sky-high mountains.\
The Topaz represents **[#](157687)MATTER.[#]()**

Magenta light refracts in this gemstone.\
Formed over eons in the geodes, this gemstone radiates awe. It is a symbol of permanence and found in the deepest layers of the world.\
\
The Amethyst represents **[#](641f9c)TIME[#]()**.

This yellow gemstone is found close to surface level where the suns light dissipates into warmth.\
\
Its bright yellow luster radiates pure **[#](f0af15)ENERGY[#]()** and makes it slightly warm to the touch at all times.

Onyx is nearly pitch black. It almost seems as if it drains the light from its surroundings.\
\
The Onyx, as a combination of energy, matter, and time, serves as a reinforcing focus and **[#](000000)CATALYST[#]()** for magical tools and devices.

Its bluish-white shimmer reminds you of the soothing light of the moon on a calm summer night. The tranquility it exudes leaves a calming, yet significant impression, like a sleeping cat - balm for the soul and yet a predator, always on guard.\
\
The Moonstone embodies pure **[#](d0d6d7)MAGIC[#]()**.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.what_hap: What happened down there?
What happened down there?

*On the trail of the history of the Deeper Down*.\
\
There is no question that, despite the lack of light, there must once have lived a highly advanced civilisation down here. But all you found were ruins.\
What happened? Surely you can find clues to their whereabouts. Demise? Legacy?
Where to look
Is there any place you have not searched yet?
Now that Bedrock isn't the bottom anymore, what is there to find?
How were the ruins you found in the Overworld created?
How did the Black Langast come to be?
Those bones in the Dragonrot Swamps... can they be broken?
What about these weird Crystals in the Crystal Gardens?
Can you find Geodes around here, too?
Clue: Biomes
You searched far and wide for a place that you might could have missed. But no matter where you look, there's not a soul in sight.
Clue: Dimension Floor
It's like turtles all the way down. A moment ago you thought Bedrock was indestructible and now here you are. Unbreakable? Possibly. For now, at least.
Clue: Excavation Sites

Apparently Downstone was not completely indestructible for the previous inhabitants? It took immense, high-tech constructs, but they were able to process the stone and make what you called "Preservation Stone".
Clue: Black Langast
The remains growing in [Black Langast](entry://dimension/black_langast) were actually Resonant Lilies, once. What happened here? Does that mean...
Clue: Dragonbone

You keep coming across gigantic skeletons. Whether they were really dragons is still written in the stars, but whatever they were, they were certainly powerful. Did they wipe out the inhabitants and then somehow meet their own end?
Clue: Hummingstone
Humming stones with a lot of indwelling energy. When vibrated, they rock each other without any other external influences until they break into splinters. Some kind of energy source?
Clue: Moonstone
The dazzling white geodes down here are unlike any you have seen before and harbour immense magical power. But why do they only exist here? More questions...
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.name: Progression Hints
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.amethyst.p: There is a type of geode found deep underground.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.azurite.pa: There is a new blue ore that can be found in the Overworld in all biomes.
This rich blue ore generates very deep down under the surface and is fairly rare.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.citrine.pa: There is one type of geode that is commonly found near the surface. It is most likely to be found exposed in lakes or ravines.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.clover.pag: Search for a Plains biome. Maybe you get lucky!

In Plains biomes, you will find Clover growing in small patches, most of them with three, but some with four leaves. You can immediately notice a Four-Leaved Clover in its block form already and distinguish it from a three-leaved one. Break to harvest, Bonemeal/Nature's Staff to spread.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.downstone_: The deeper you dig into the underground of the Deeper Down, the more often you come across rocks that seem indestructible. There is something to discover at this height.
Near the lowest layers of the Deeper Down, you will sometimes stumble across structures with which the former inhabitants were able to carve this stone.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.dragonbone: In Dragonrot Swamps, the remains of gigantic creatures can be found. These blocks seem to be impossible to mine in the classical way, as they are protected by a magical aura. Is there an unconventional way to break this aura, maybe using great force?

Dragonbone Blocks can be damaged using powerful explosions. You will need something with quite a bit more explosion power than TNT, for example Incandescent Amalgam. Though you feel that strong magical explosions might have a similar effect, breaching their protective aura.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.fading.pag: Fading, as a small and weak organism, feeds on organic blocks placed next to it. Right click with the bottle to place it like a block; you can bottle it again to pick it back up.

Place organic blocks like Leaves, Pumpkins or Melons next to a Block of Fading and wait a while. The block will get consumed and replaced with a different looking variant. Break those converted blocks to get a new resource.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.failing.pa: Just like Fading, they prefer a specific block placed next to them. This time a lot stronger, though. 'I hate mining this'-strong, to be precise.
The preferred food is Obsidian. Watch out for their insatiable hunger, though. They will eat quite a lot, if given the chance...
There is a new ore that can be found in the Deeper Down.
It is bright green and is found in the deepest parts of Deeper Down. It's not often found exposed to the air, so the best way to get it is by branch mining.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.mermaids_g: Sometimes there are shiny gems found in oceans, floating on top of the water, getting rocked back and forth by the waves. If you spend some time near or in the ocean you may find one yourself!

The source of these gems is a coral-looking plant that grows on the seabed in small groups, disguised as sea grass. Wait next to it until it is fully grown and releases its precious treasure, then collect it. After you collect one, you will be able to see the plant for what it is.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.midnight_c: This liquid, which was created during the creation of the Midnight Aberration... it damages every creature it touches.

Midnight Solution has various effects depending on what lands in it. Enchanted items lose their magical powers, some items change altogether, and creatures killed by it drop a small mysterious fragment.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.moonstone_: The lower plains of the Deeper Down seem to have once been home to a highly developed civilisation.
Some of the cities left behind house a highly guarded structure. Their protectors seem mechanical, powered by delicate magitech.
There is a new turquoise ore that can be found in the End.
This ore, which you can now perceive, is formed both on the central island and in the outer regions of the End. Catch it before it's too late!
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.preservati: There are 3 different kinds of impenetrable structures hidden at around the start of the Deepslate layer in the Overworld in any biome. They seem to be built from an unbreakable stone.

The entrance seems to be blocked by a powerful force field. Whoever built those was kind enough to leave you clues, however! The hearts on the force field's sides seem to indicate you have to have Azure Dike active.
The Colored Spore Blossoms at the ceiling and the engravings behind them on the walls seem to hint at the solution. A powder engraving and a '? + ?'. You have to mix Powders?
Is there a way to crack open the Bedrock? After you get in, best to take a look at the corresponding pages in your book for everything you find there. Always good to have some dyes with you.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.quitoxic_r: Time for an adventure trip on the surface. Visit a Swamp or Mangrove Swamp!
Strange looking plants have been seen in all kinds of swamps, growing on patches of Clay or Mud. When growing, they will consume Clay/Mud in the process, turning it to Dirt.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.radiating_: Not every block an Enderman carries is what it looks like at first glance.

Some Endermen appear in the Overworld carrying blocks that could very well be small relics of the End itself. You can get a hold of one by killing an Endermen while it carries what looks like Cobblestone. Endermen holding these blocks can also be found in the End, albeit more rarely.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.resonance_: Between Liquid Crystal lakes, you frequently find crystalline structures that consist of blocks that inherit interesting properties when interacted with.

Hummingstones, which are part of Hummingstone Crystals, start to vibrate when disturbed, making other Hummingstones in their vicinity vibrate, too. The more stones are close to each other, the stronger the echo will be.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.ruin.name: Experiment #3
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.ruin.page0: This absolutely aggressive variant called Ruin is able to consume the most resistant material there is. Even ones too resistant for you to ever break before.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.ruin.page1: What could be more resistant than the unbreakable Bedrock itself? Better have a backup plan up your sleeve if anything goes wrong.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.shimmersto: There is a new ore to be found in the Overworld at and above surface level.
It generates in all biomes in the center and upper layers of the Overworld in large veins. Most often you can find it exposed in mountains.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.stargazing: Shooting Stars only show up at night. Having something ready to better see them in the darkness will surely help a lot. They show up with a noticeable particle trail.

Your best chances to see a Shooting Star are to search for it with Night Vision and a Spyglass equipped. If you see one crashing down try to trace its steps to find out where it landed. They shoot up particles like a beam.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.storm_ston: Thunderstorms are a powerful display of nature. There are tremendous energies playing.
Sometimes you are able to find weird shards at places where lightning struck. There even is a way to focus lightning at a specific position, to make gathering them even more efficient.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.stratine.p: There is a new ore that can be found in the Nether.
It generates in the lower layers of the Nether in all biomes, below lava level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.topaz.name: A Gemstone
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.topaz.page: This type of geode is found at great heights, typically on top of hills and sky-high mountains.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.name: Ink
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.color_picker:
Converts [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) into pure [Ink](entry://ink/ink)[#](), which you can supply to your magical items.\
Used to fill Ink Containers, like [Ink Flasks](entry://ink/ink_flask)[#]().\
Unfortunately - [you remember how Ink is transferred](entry://ink/ink@transfer)[#]() - there is always residue left behind. You can't use the full amount, though the transfer is quicker the bigger the difference.
*Never develop a passion you can't afford. It'll eat your heart away like a bookworm.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.crystal_apot:
Placed in [Geodes](entry://general/geodes), automatically harvests fully grown [#](bb00bb)Gemstone Clusters[#]().\
\
Normally all your other constructions and even crops pretty much freeze in time when you are away, but this construct seems to continue working even then. Weird.
While it's not as efficient as breaking the clusters with a [#](bb00bb)Pickaxe[#](), the ease of use surely comes in handy.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.ink_assortme: This collection of small vials is able to store all kinds of [Ink](entry://ink/ink)[#](), albeit just small amounts of it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.ink_flask.pa: The Ink Flask is able to hold a sizable amount of [Ink](entry://ink/ink)[#]() of a single color.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.ink.name: Ink
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.ink.page0.te:
Now that you're familiar with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#](), you see no reason to lug it around like you did in the Middle Ages. You have found a way to convert [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() into a higher form of energy!\
\
You called it [#](157687)I[#](aa32a0)n[#](f0af15)k[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.ink.page1.te:
[Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() can be converted to Ink using the [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker) and then extracted into containers, like [Ink Flasks](entry://ink/ink_flask).\
\
The only drawback: deprived of its physical form, there is no way to transform Ink back into [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.ink.page2.te: Ink behaves a bit like gas. It flows from where it is abundant to where there is little.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.ink.page3.te:
\
When two objects that store Ink are connected - such as a [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker)[#]() and an [Ink Flask](entry://ink/ink_flask)[#]() - the Ink between the two containers slowly evens out.\
The greater the difference, the faster the Flask is filled.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.pigment_pale:
Carrying around enough [Ink](entry://ink/ink)[#]() with you to maintain your magical equipment has become both a chore and a space hog in your inventory.\
Now that you're familiar with [Ink](entry://ink/ink)[#](), it's time for a new creation: the Pigment Palette.

Capable of storing sizable amounts of [Ink](entry://ink/ink)[#](), making you able to supply all your magical equipment. It is not suited for powering your machines, though.\
*Now you are a true Artist of Color.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_blocks.b:
You've already used your anvil plenty (lots of anvils, to be precise). [Item Crushing](entry://general/item_crushing), repairing and enchanting are burning a hole in your iron supply.\
To make the anvil last longer - or even make it indestructible - Bedrock seems like the perfect choice.\
Allows you to rename items for free and has no maximum repair limit.

Also enables you to add descriptions to your items.\
*Pro tip: type \n to split your text into multiple lines.*

The problem with hoppers is that they are not only slow, but also poorly suited for larger farms due to their non-existent range.\
\
With a bit of application of blue pigment, all items in a large radius around the crate can easily be brought to safety.
Radius of 12 blocks. You can disable it by placing a block on top. Offers filters to specify which items it should accept.
Putting a [Knowledge Gem](entry://enchanting/knowledge_gem)[#]() into a Black Hole Chest allows it to absorb XP orbs, putting the experience into the gem.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_blocks.c: A state-of-your-art blast furnace, which consumes [#](e16201)Orange Ink[#]() to smelt ores and the like.
Supplying a [Knowledge Gem](entry://enchanting/knowledge_gem)[#]() allows you to automatically collect XP while smelting.
The Cinderhearth's abilities can be enhanced via [Upgrades](entry://magical_blocks/upgrades)[#](). Place them on the two Chiseled Blocks.

- 1 Cinderhearth
- 21 Polished Blocks
- 6 Crest Blocks
- 5 Glass-like Blocks
- 2 Chiseled Blocks
- 6 Buckets of Lava\
\
*Did it really need that [#](bb00bb)Lava[#]() underneath since you already have [#](e16201)Ink[#]()*? No, not really. But it looks so much better.*

[Upgrades](entry://magical_blocks/upgrades)[#]() placed on the [#](bb00bb)Chiseled Blocks[#]() do not work automatically, but requires you to supply an additional type of [Ink](entry://ink/ink) to the Cinderhearth. The higher the upgrades, the higher the consumption.

- Speed ([#](aa32a0)Magenta Ink[#]()):\
faster smelt times\

- Yield ([#](258ac8)Light Blue Ink[#]()):\
chance to multiply the output for most blocks\

- Experience ([#](641f9c)Purple Ink[#]()):\
vastly increases experience gain\

- Efficiency ([#](000000)Black Ink[#]()):\
greatly decreases Ink consumption of the other types, including [#](e16201)Orange[#]()

You are long tired of creating new storage space for all the coal, iron, copper and gold that are piling up in your storage room. Assembling this stuff to more compact clumps again and again is no fun, either.\
\
So, you thought up the Compacting Chest, which takes this monotonous work off your hands.

The name says it all.\
The Compacting Chest will try to craft all the things you put into it in a 3x3, 2x2 or 1x1 pattern - able to be toggled in its GUI.

With budding blocks in mind you designed the Crystallarieum: an Ink-powered contraption that grows chunks of raw ore into sparkling crystals. Though your best efforts failed to grow actual [gems](entry://general/shards), you quickly realised that it could grow all sorts of other resources instead.\
\
Throw raw ore on top to let it crystallize into a Bud, able to be grown.

Each catalyst has a different effect on bud growth:\
while one catalyst may reduce the required amount of ink, another may alter the duration of the process..

[#](449900)Metallic resources[#]() require unrefined materials such as [#](bb00bb)Raw Iron[#](), resulting in a [#](bb00bb)Small Iron Bud[#]() that will grow steadily until it can be safely harvested.\
\
For [#](449900)crystalline resources[#](), an existing crystal can be used as a seed to grow identical copies of itself.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_blocks.e:
The Ender Dropper is the counterpart to the [Ender Hopper](entry://magical_blocks/ender_hopper)[#](). With every [#](449900)redstone pulse[#]() it ejects an item from your personal [#](bb00bb)Ender Chest[#]().\
\
Beware: Who's stopping anyone from placing a button next to it and emptying your [#](bb00bb)Ender Chest[#]()?
The Ender Dropper only works while you are online.

Designed to resemble an ordinary hopper in form and function, the Ender Hopper has the special ability to put items directly into your [#](bb00bb)Ender Chest[#](). Counterpart to the [Ender Dropper](entry://magical_blocks/ender_dropper)[#]().
The Ender Hopper only works while you are online.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_blocks.f:
The Pigment Pedestal is wonderful for automatically creating items. But if you need the same few items over and over again, you'll have to rearrange your whole construction.\
\
Of course, you have found a more than adequate solution for that.

The Fabrication Chest has four slots for [Crafting Tablets](entry://equipment/crafting_tablet)[#](). The recipes you have defined in these are always kept in stock - as long as the ingredients in the chest allow it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_blocks.g:
With the magic inherent in gemstone dust you have [already managed to change seedlings](entry://general/colored_trees)[#](). What's stopping you from trying it on other plants?\
Not because you're greedy or anything, of course.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_blocks.h:
It happens again and again that you just quickly put down a box to store your belongings and as you come back find everything looted.\
To solve this issue you have developed this special chest, which can even help you to catch the thief in the act.
The Heartbound Chest can only be opened by its placer and provides the same space as two normal chests.

Similar to a Trapped Chest it also outputs a [#](449900)redstone signal[#]().\
If you as the owner open it, the signal strength will be full, if a stranger wants to tamper with your belongings then only half.
Created from a collision of [Stratine](entry://general/stratine) and [Paltaeria](entry://general/paltaeria), this block just sits around in the air when placed.

...well, other blocks seem to be able to float in the air without support just fine for whatever reason, too, but this one is special: [#](449900)it preserves any momentum that you give it[#](), like via [#](bb00bb)Piston[#](), even if you stand on it.\
\
Tip: Sneak+Use to pick it back up.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_blocks.i: Idols
Idols

Manifestations of a creature in block form.\
\
Using them, walking on them, or hitting them with a projectile triggers an action that is specifically associated with that creature.
Gives a short burst of Regeneration.
Echolocates creatures in a 8 blocks radius around it.
Fertilizes plants next to it.

Smelts ore, heats [#](bb00bb)Netherrack[#]() to [#](bb00bb)Magma Blocks[#](), ...)\
Also sets the creature that triggered it and blocks next to it on fire.
Negates all fall damage when landed upon. Can also temporarily reset your fall.
Gives a short burst of Slow Falling.
Milks all Cows, Goats and Mooshrooms in a 6 block radius.
Causes a small explosion.
Shoots a Dragon Projectile.
Teleports to a random position in a 16 block radius.
Teleports to another Jagged Idol in a straight line on the side that was hit (up to 16 blocks away).
Summons a Vex.
Gives a short burst of Water Breathing.
Gives a short burst of Haste.
Shoots a Fireball.
Gives a short burst of Glowing.
Causes knockback.
Gives a short burst Mining Fatigue.
Gives a short burst of Strength.
Gives a short burst of Invisibility.
Gives a short burst of Night Vision.
Gives a short burst of Absorption.

Causes Insomnia.\
When in open sky, a player will immediately get haunted by a [#](449900)Phantom[#]().
Feeds animals in a 6 block radius if food is lying around.
Trades [#](bb00bb)Gold Ingots[#]() with you.
Freezes blocks around it (freezing [#](bb00bb)Water[#]() to [#](bb00bb)Ice[#](), cooling [#](bb00bb)Lava[#]() to [#](bb00bb)Obsidian[#](), ...).
Gives a short burst of Nausea.
Gives a short burst of Jump Boost.
Shears creatures in a 6 block radius.
Gives a short burst of Levitation.
Invades blocks next to it with Silverfish.
Shoots an [#](bb00bb)Arrow[#]().
Increases the size of Slimes in a 6 block radius.
Shoots a [#](bb00bb)Snowball[#]().
Gives a short burst of Poison.
Gives a short burst of Blindness.
Gives a short burst of Slowness.
Gives a short burst of Fire Resistance.
Gives a short burst of Resistance.
Gives a short burst of Weakness.
Creates a huge explosion.
Gives a short burst of Wither.
Converts Villagers to Zombie Villagers.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_blocks.l:
When you held a [#](bb00bb)Wet Sponge[#]() in your hands, you thought that there must be a counterpart for [#](bb00bb)Lava[#](), too. Even though you haven't stumbled across one yet, that hasn't stopped you from inventing one, of course.\
\
This should make navigation in the depths of the world and beyond that hellish portal much easier.

...or so you thought, until you realized that the lava-soaked sponge also has an *unfortunate* side effect.\
You should have guessed.
The Lava Sponge can be used as highly efficient fuel in the [#](bb00bb)Furnace[#](), drying it in the process.
The pure energy of gemstones in liquid form. It is said to have a healing effect.
Combining it with various other liquids results in all kinds of interesting looking materials.

Letting Liquid Crystal collide with [Liquid Mud](entry://magical_blocks/mud)[#]() created [#](bb00bb)Clay[#]()! Surely there are more combinations to discover!\
\
*Thomas had never seen such unbalance before.*

Letting a full block of Liquid Crystal absorb the immense heat of Lava resulted in this.\
Almost feels like a [#](bb00bb)Magma Block[#](), albeit way hotter.

As [#](bb00bb)Water[#]() tried to flow into a full block of Liquid Crystal the crystal solidified.\
Since even a light touch is enough to give you a cold shiver, you called it Frostbite Crystal.
This is an interesting one. When [#](bb00bb)Flowers[#]() absorb this magical liquid through their roots, they turn into those elusive plants.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_blocks.m:
You stumbled upon this bizarre liquid as a direct result of [your failed fusion experiment](entry://general/midnight_aberration)[#](). Pity, really, but look what you have now.\
Creatures that touch it seem to get their life drained out of them. Interesting...\
Better not get caught in it yourself.

Creatures that die in that feisty liquid drop a small splinter that almost resembles a [Midnight Aberration](entry://general/midnight_aberration), just way, way smaller. Sharp-Edged and vicious.\
Creatures unalived by this cruel process also seem to [#](449900)drop items as if they were killed by a player[#]().
Using the exact drop that you got by killing creatures with that fluid you can create even more of it. Quite morbid, if you think about it.
A seemingly useless material that forms around pools of Midnight Solution.
Throwing some items into the liquid seems to corrupt them up to a point they turn into something else entirely.
Even more, if you throw enchanted items into it, they will be stripped of their special abilities. All that's left is the ordinary item and a bunch of experience.

Highly modular explosives, consisting of:
- an [#](449900)Archetype[#]() (damaging entities, destroying blocks, both, or just purely cosmetic)
- and [#](449900)Modifiers[#]() (changing the damage type, lighting fire, increasing the blast radius, damage and much more)

Use the [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal)[#]() to combine a Modular Explosive with items specifying Archetype and to add Modifiers.\
\
You can customize a whole stack of explosives at once.

A magic mine that, once placed, primes after a few seconds and explodes at first touch, dealing a huge chunk of damage. Use a [Midnight Chip](entry://general/midnight_solution@midnight_chip) to disarm and safely dismantle it.
A multifunctional explosive, which can be placed on walls and detonated, as well as thrown. Harmless to living beings by default.

- Gunpowder: Destroying Blocks
- Glowstone Dust: Dealing Damage
- Midnight Aberration: Both\
\
You can also combine both separately.

- TNT: Increased radius
- Chorus Fruit: Starry Particles
- Shimmerstone: Placement of invisible lights

- Fire Charge: Fire
- Doombloom Seed: Primordial Fire
- Storm Stone: Lightning Damage
- Neolith: Magic Damage
- Incandescent Amalgam: Incandescent Damage
- End Rod: Greatly increased damage when near explosion center

- Stratine Fragments: Square block breaking shape
- Four Leaf Clover: Fortune
- Mermaids Gem: Silk Touch
- Ender Pearl: Inventory Insertion

Modular Explosives come with a suitable archetype builtin. Though if you want to change that, put it into the [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal)[#]() to [#](449900)clear both Archetype and Modifiers[#]() and start from scratch.

Mud. It is wet mud. Not particularly interesting in and of itself. What is practical is the collision of the mud with other liquids, like [#](bb00bb)Water[#]() or [#](bb00bb)Lava[#](). This creates [#](bb00bb)Dirt[#]() or [#](bb00bb)Coarse Dirt[#](), respectively.
*While a mud bath sounds like wellness, it is not advised.*

Some items that come into contact with Mud get tanned.\
For example, [#](bb00bb)Rotten Flesh[#]() will be converted to a tiny piece of [#](bb00bb)Hide[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_blocks.p:
The people around you have already helped you in one or the other dicey situation. It's time to give something back. A pinch of [Shimmerstone](entry://general/shimmerstone) allows the package to explode in a colorful shower of particles.\
Click the Present onto the items you want to gift, wrap it in a [#](bb00bb)Crafting Table[#](), then all you have to do is place it down for the recipient to open it and watch them jump in joy.
*(Or, you know, you can always gift your future self!)*

- Place a filled Present in a crafting grid to wrap it.
- Optional: add [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() for a colorful particle shower
- Optional: add a special item to choose a wrapping paper:
- Red Dye: Red
- Blue Dye: Blue

- Cyan Dye: Cyan
- Green Dye: Green
- Purple Dye: Purple
- Cake: Cake
- Flower: Stripes
- Firework Star: Starry
- Snowball: Winter
- Spore Blossom: Rainbow
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_blocks.s:
For a long time now, those annoying monsters that always appear at night are no longer a threat to you and only serve as a resource supplier, if at all. But that doesn't stop them from pursuing you further.\
You spend more time keeping those pesky monsters out of your base than you care to admit.[#]()

Then you remember the [Gemstone Glass recipe](entry://decoration/gemstone_glass) you thought up earlier.\
\
With a bit of magical energy, it should be no problem to make it not only transparent, but also passable for you (not for them!).\
\
Bonus: If you make it look exactly like regular glass you might even be able to fool your competition.[#]()
While it looks exactly like its [mundane counterpart](entry://decoration/gemstone_glass)[#](), only players can pass through it. All other creatures will bounce, like a fly off a window.
Semi-permeable Glass comes in all gemstone colors. Simply replace the [#](bb00bb)Amethyst[#]() with the gem of your choice.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_blocks.u:
This strange block lets your vision penetrate ground and rock. Placed directly on a wall or on the ground, it allows you to glimpse the other side.\
\
*The creations that [Radiating Ender](entry://general/radiating_ender)* allows you to create with its strange properties never cease to amaze you.*

The Pigment Pedestal and Fusion Shrine have already proven their worth. But there is still plenty of room for improvement. That's why you created these upgrades. Each one improves the properties of your structures in a different way, depending on what's most important to you personally.\
Additional upgrades of the same type have a decreased effect.
The crafting time of the [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) increases a lot when using complex components. This will help you bring back the times to an acceptable level.
The Pedestal Accelerator T2 improves all aspects of the previous variant. Making your crafting even more rapid.
Tier 3 leaves nothing to be desired - at least in terms of crafting speed.
For the most part the experience [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) crafting rewards is pretty much negligible. But using this Focus you could dramatically increase the amount gained.
This improved Knowledge Focus increases the generated XP even more.

The [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) devours vast amounts of Gemstone Powder.\
Now you should be able to cushion the consumption of your structures a little.
This 'upgrade of the upgrade' further reduces the consumption of input materials.

This is an interesting one. Although the chance is very small, you can increase your crafting outputs.\
*More bang for your buck!*
This upgraded version is much more potent, allowing you to get even more output for your crafting.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.dr:
What your musings have created here is nothing short of a masterwork of versatility.\
This double-headed sword is exquisitely balanced, allowing for wide and powerful sweeping attacks. The delicate [Bloodstone](entry://creating_life/bloodstone) construction of the weapon makes it delightfully stalwart, and excellent at keeping an edge.
The [#](f0af15)Yellow Ink[#]() coursing through the sword allows you to throw it at extreme speeds by striking it after tossing it upwards. Catch it with right-click - just be mindful of the rebound.

However, the dynamism of this weapon goes on much further.By swapping hands while you are holding this and your other hand is open, you can split the sword in two, resulting in a pair of twinned daggers. Swift and deadly, these too can be thrown, though to a different effect. Those same wisps of fluttering dandelion come to enable some particularly nefarious mobility.

You can throw the daggers and recall them freely after doing so - flinging you towards it, or alternatively flinging mobs it hit towards you. There are a lot of things that affect how and who moves, so play around with it.

As a footnote, the weapon has some unique enchant interactions per-form.\
[Inertia](entry://enchanting/enchantments/inertia) will boost the Twinsword's strength each time it rebounds, while the talon's yoink on entities becomes stronger.\
[Improved Critical](entry://enchanting/enchantments/improved_critical) improves critical hits against airborne targets.\
Channeling improves the sweep and trades single target ranged damage for AoE.\
Piercing does exactly what you would expect.

An unwelcoming, yet entrancing weapon.\
*Try not to get yourself killed using it.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.ar:
This map shifts and changes when you move, almost seeming like it is alive and could sense your intentions.\
Used in a structure, this alas will guide you through treacherous terrain, across raging rivers, and through dense forests to find structures of similar kind.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.ba:
Placing an [#](bb00bb)Ender Chest[#](), opening it, and mining it with an enchanted pickaxe is not what you think of as fun.\
That's why you invented this thing.
Just open it and the contents of your [#](bb00bb)Ender Chest[#]() are right there.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.bl:
Like a caveman, you've always run around manually illuminating caves, or closing their unsightly entries in your immediate vicinity. To relieve you of this work you took the self-replicating abilities of [Fading](entry://general/fading) as an inspiration and developed the Block Flooder.\
Thrown into a narrow path, pond or ravine, those get filled - in 5%% of the cases the result even looks acceptable!
Pulls matching blocks directly from your inventory to fill the gaps. If you don't have any matching ones, it will fall back to Cobblestone.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.bo:
On your journeys through the underground you collect a whole lot of identical blocks, which you will never need again. But they are too good to throw away, you think.\
Time to develop a storage solution that takes care of your little homemade problem:\
The Bottomless Bundle stores a virtually unlimited number of items, but of only one type.
Right click it on stacks or empty slots in your inventory to fill / empty it.
Crouching places it down, making it able to be automatically filled / emptied.

A placed Bottomless Bundle will always remember the last item you put into it.\
Even if it is emptied it will only accept new items that it was holding before, making it also usable as a filter.\
\
*Note: If it was placed empty it will accept the first item pumped into it and get locked to that.*

Enchanting a Bottomless Bundle with Power by using the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanting_items) you can increase its capacity tenfold for each level of Power.\
\
*Are you able to fill a Bottomless Bundle with Power V?*

Enchanting a Bottomless Bundle with Curse of the Void by using the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanting_items) will result in voiding all items that would overfill the Bottomless Bundle.\
\
*No more useless blocks cluttering your path when mining.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.ce:
The problem with [Onyx Shards](entry://general/onyx_shards)[#]() is that their creation is tied to very specific conditions. It is not every day that there is a new moon. Every time you look at the clock, the window of time seems to have just passed by for two minutes.\
Time to break out the big guns: Magenta's affinity for time.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.co:
