You always spend a lot of time placing blocks. You could almost think that this is the main reason for your existence. Placing a lot of similar blocks is tedious.\
\
Or more like: *Was* tedious.
Crouch-Click to get a selection of all available placement modi.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.cr: The Crafting Tablet is so much more than a portable Crafting Table. It saves a recipe you inserted and lets you craft it on demand.

There may come a time when you feel you need a certain material so often that you want to automate it. Or you're one of those masochists who automate every single item because they can.\
\
The [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal)[#]() has a dedicated slot for a Crafting Tablet. When you add items with hoppers or similar to the pedestal, they will be placed appropriately and evenly, like specified in the saved recipe.

This clock, made up of witnesses to time, is intended to guide you through this never-ending stream of beginnings and endings - the phases of the moon.\
\
\
\
*If we shadows have offended, Know but this and all is mended.*

*That you have but slumbered here, While these visions did appear.\
And this weak and idle theme, No more yielding, but a dream.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.en:
Your pickaxe, which was sinfully expensive to enchant? Almost broken and each additional broken block damages your nerves more than the tool itself.\
Even if the tool can't be saved, at least the enchantments will! This canvas does not only capture color: Used on a tool, the enchantments are exchanged.
Once used, an image of the item you used it on will manifest on the canvas, never be removed again, binding it to this type of item.

The most interesting thing about the Endermen is, without question, their teleportation ability. You were pretty successful replicating it! However, to determine the destination of your teleport, you must first take a snapshot of the position.\
Endermen don't have to do that, it seems. Why?

Use to bind it to your current position.\
The second use will teleport you back. Can even be used on other players. Cannot teleport you across dimensions.
Enchanting an Ender Splice with Unbreaking by using the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanting_items) decreases the chance of it breaking on use.
Enchanting an Ender Splice with Resonance by using the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanting_items) will allow for interdimensional teleport.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.ev:
A ribbon, gifted to pets as an everlasting promise to watch out and care for them.\
Name it and attach it on a creature. Should it ever die it will drop a [#](bb00bb)Broken Promise[#]().

Your pet will immediately trust you if it does not already. Use a [#](bb00bb)Crafting Table[#]() to add [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() to the [#](bb00bb)Ribbon[#]() to give your pet a colored name.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.ex: For all those who don't either live in a simple [#](bb00bb)Cobblestone[#]() house or live without walls entirely - of course you don't feel addressed - you have thought up the Exchanging Staff.
*Mining just got a whole bunch more fun*
Enchanting an Exchanging Staff with Fortune by using the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanting_items) allows it to multiply ore drops when exchanging similar to using a common Fortune tool.

Enchanting an Exchanging Staff with Silk Touch by using the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanting_items) will give it the power to exchange blocks exactly how they appear in the world, without breaking the more fragile blocks, like glass or ores.
Enchanting an Exchanging Staff with Resonance by using the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanting_items) will give it the power to harvest some special blocks as-is.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.in:
The sun on the palm of your hand sounded far better in theory. \
\
Now that it sits there... well, it burns. The simple fact that it exists is almost a miracle - really, it should have exploded in the barrel - an unstable, simmering amalgam of ethanol blended with a cocktail of accelerants that hates existing.

A single wrong move could easily cause it to detonate, taking everything nearby with it including yourself. And yet, for all those reasons and more, the soft, warm glow of the gel elicits endless curiosity. All things are drawn to the flame. There is no question that what is effectively a high yield magical explosive bears endless potential. All you need is a little care, a small mountain of it, and a hint of reckless abandon.

*my very own sun...*\
\
The longer the synthesis goes on, the higher the yield... you really can't blame the angels for not wanting a cut of this.
The pristine burn of the amalgam makes it uniquely suited for pure alcohol distillation
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.kn:
Whenever you pick up one of those little green orbs that appear whenever you kill an enemy, you get smarter - supposedly.\
\
However, the inevitable death by clumsiness means that you always lose this experience quickly. Crystallized and safely stored in your chests, however, they will be as safe as can be.[#]()

A Gem holds up to 10,000 experience. [Enchanting](entry://enchanting/enchanting_items)[#]() it with [#](449900)Efficiency[#]() increases that limit, [#](449900)Quick Charge[#]() boosts the pushing/pulling of XP.
Putting a Knowledge Gem into a [Black Hole Chest](entry://magical_blocks/black_hole_chest)[#]() allows it to absorb XP orbs, putting the experience into the Gem.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.na:
Using the magic elements of [#](613c20)Nature[#]() and [#](5faa19)Fertility[#](), you have come up with this stroke of genius.\
Bonemeal is a joke when compared to your new gadget.
*Point at something you want to see blossom*

Enchanting the Nature's Staff with Efficiency by using the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanting_items) decreases the chance of [Vegetal](entry://general/fading@vegetal) to get consumed for each level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.pe:
Every time you want to enter the realm of the Endermen, you have to travel half a world. Whoever created the portals to the End... you're so much more powerful than they are now.\
\
Well, almost. Probably.\
You still haven't figured out how to create such portals yourself, but packing them up and taking them home? *No problem.*
The End Portal, like found in Strongholds.
Due to the extremely sturdy portal frames, these can be quite destructive. It is best to keep a bit of distance after socketing.
You just put the portal back together the way it was, re-add Eyes of Ender, done!
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.pi:
[Moonstone Cores](entry://dimension/moonstone_cores)[#]() are bursting with energy. It sounds like a very bad idea to discharge one within milliseconds.\
\
*...but sometimes the worst ideas are the best, aren't they?*\
\
Their explosion does not damage blocks, but causes [immensely aggressive fire](entry://dimension/primordial_fire).
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.ra:
Torches have one crucial weakness: you can only place them when you're already standing in the dark. In contrast, the Radiance Staff can place lights far away and in the air, illuminating large caverns at a distance.\
As a final goodie, these lights are invisible, making them great for illuminating your structures atmospherically.

Right click placed lights with the staff to adjust the emitted light level.\
They can even be summoned under water.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.st:
*One to rule them all*\
...well, politely, of course.\
\
The Staff of Remembrance allows you to move around your animals with ease, both short and long distance.
Tap animals to recollect them into a [Memory](entry://creating_life/memories)[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.va: There are a few items that have always been difficult to get. Your new skills should make it much easier to get them.
"Any technology advanced enough is indistinguishable from magic," you once heard.\
You're still not entirely sure how this storage system manages to store so many blocks in such a small space, but since you regularly walk around with hundreds of square metres of dirt, you've never bothered to question it.
Looks like - despite the name - the [#](bb00bb)Crystal Growth Accelerator[#]() can grow more than just quartz! It can also grow other types of gemstones.
The [Crystal Apothecary](entry://ink/crystal_apothecary)[#]() not only harvests [#](bb00bb)Gemstone Buds[#](), but also [#](bb00bb)Certus Quartz[#]().
Tools enchanted with [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance)[#]() are able to harvest [#](bb00bb)Budding Quartz[#](), while retaining their *flawless* state.

Many of AE2's items can be [crushed to dust with an anvil](entry://general/item_crushing): [#](bb00bb)Certus Quartz[#](), [#](bb00bb)Fluix[#](), [#](bb00bb)Skystone[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Ender Pearls[#]().
In desperate need of [#](bb00bb)Charged Certus Quartz[#]()? [Storm Stones](entry://general/storm_stones)[#]() will charge them up in a heartbeat.
...and then create [#](bb00bb)Fluix[#]() from it, if you get impatient.
Being crystalline structures, [#](bb00bb)Certus Quartz[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Fluix Crystals[#]() can be grown in the Crystallarieum.

Hardened by heat and pressure, beautiful Alloy Forges can be made from calcite and basalt.\
\
Perhaps you will find more minerals to use during your adventure? The best thing to do is to write them all down here.

In addition, some items can be used as special fuel for Alloy Forges. Some ores have increased output when smelted in one.\
\
Tell Noaaan I said hi!
Quite slow, but packs a lot of fuel.
Twice as fast as the Basalt variant, but you will have to restock on fuel quite more often.
A high-tier Forge with medium speed and fuel capacity.
A high-end forge with incredible capacity and reasonable smelting speed.
A high-end forge that melts at an incomparable temperature. Low capacity compared to other Alloy Forges.
An exceptional forge that accelerates the melting process with additional pressure. Holds a reasonable amount of fuel.
Pure resources can be turned into their mundane counterpart, with a nice multiplier.
Using a high tier [#](449900)Alloy Forge[#]() you can squeeze quite a bit more [Stratine](entry://general/stratine) from the raw ore.
A dripping [#](bb00bb)Lava Sponge[#]() contains enough heat to fuel your Alloy Forge for quite some time.
Also a good heat source for your Alloy Forges.
You recently found new materials scattered across the landscape in new, beautiful terrain. You are sure you can make use of those in some way.
The [Crystal Apothecary](entry://ink/crystal_apothecary)[#]() not only harvests [#](bb00bb)Gemstone Buds[#](), but also [#](bb00bb)Illunite Shards[#]().
You found a plethora of colorful flowers growing around forests and plains in small patches. What's up with those? Definitely worth a look if you haven't tinkered with them already.
While crushing flowers seems a bit unorthodox, it *did* work. No problem plucking the petals from the flattened blossom after that.

Having studied not only botany but also color theory, you definitely recognize some similarities. The colored flowers, resemble [Colored Trees](entry://general/colored_trees) in more than just one point.\
\
No wonder that their petals can also be used to create [Ink](entry://ink/ink).
Adding some [Shimmerstone](entry://general/shimmerstone) to magical flowers makes them glimmer.
Applying [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) to mushrooms colors them in the respective color.
Using [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) instead of mundane Dye when creating [#](bb00bb)Floral Fertilizer[#]() is quite a bit more yielding.
The [#](bb00bb)Black Lotus[#]() is a great source of Mana, no questions asked. But yet, it still can be enhanced. Using some [#](449900)Jade Petals[#]()
Those elusive seeds you could only find in chests hidden around the world? Pricey - maybe not even worth the hassle - but you finally found a way to replicate them.
Enchanted Soil can be harvested using tools enchanted with [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance).

- +2 positive effects
- +1 negative effect
- makes the potion unidentifiable.\
\
*Fancy a gamble?*

- +3 positive effects
- 50%% chance for negative effect
- makes the potion unidentifiable.\
\
*Fancy a gamble?*

- +3 potency
- -3 yield\
\
Requires other reagents to increase the yield, otherwise you will end up with nothing...

- +25%% duration
- 15%% chance to add last effect

- creates Lingering Potions & Tipped Arrows
- -25%% potency
Constructors and Exchange Staffs can pull blocks from your Black Hole Talisman.
Scattered around the world you have discovered numerous geodes, which produce valuable resources.
The [Crystal Apothecary](entry://ink/crystal_apothecary)[#]() is able to harvest [#](bb00bb)Crystals[#]() automatically - even if you are not near those geodes at all!
Tools enchanted with [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance)[#]() are able to harvest Budding Blocks.

Getting lost deep below time and time again made you carry a bit of [#](bb00bb)Chalk[#]() with you, allowing you to mark your way back out. Sadly these little pieces of Calcite never last long before breaking.
By using Pigments instead of Dye, the [#](bb00bb)Chalk[#]() provides you with a never-ending supply of color.
Of course you are able to create unbreakable [#](bb00bb)Glow Chalk[#](), too.
Oh, you thought about creating colored chalk, too? Of course those can be made unbreakable, too.

*Souls, Spirits, Cages*\
Now if that isn't a work of shrewd occultism you do not know what is.

Distilled Spirits can be... \
umm.. distilled?\
*distilled further?*\
into long lasting [#](449900)Resistance[#]() Potions.

You're not even sure yourself how you came up with this recipe anymore.\
Maybe you inhaled a little too much [#](bb00bb)Quitoxic Powder[#]() when you combined various ingredients. But the result is interesting, no question.

Combining everything you learned as a Spawner expert and Pigment Tinkerer gave you the ability to create plain [#](bb00bb)Mob Spawners[#]() yourself.\
You only need to assign a Creature to spawn using the [Spirit Instiller](entry://creating_life/spirit_instiller).

Everywhere it rattles and fizzles, whistles and smokes. An ensemble of Assemblage.\
\
Surely a few of those machines will come in handy.
[#](bb00bb)Gemstones[#]() can be crushed, yielding some [#](bb00bb)Gemstone Powder[#]().
[#](bb00bb)Colored Leaves[#]() can be crushed, yielding [#](bb00bb)Pigment[#]() and a higher chance for [#](bb00bb)Colored Saplings[#]().
Crushing [#](449900)Colored Logs[#]() results in some additional [#](449900)Pigment[#]().
Milling [Frostbite Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal_essences)[#]() will yield you a nice amount of [#](bb00bb)Frostbite Essence[#]().
Milling [Blazing Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal_essences)[#]() will yield you a nice amount of [#](bb00bb)Incandescent Essence[#]().
New biomes bring new possibilities. But which?
To an outsider, an alchemist might well be mistaken for a magician. Time to get to know the differences - but also the similarities.
Scattered around the world you have discovered numerous geodes, which produce not only colored gems, but also valuable resources.
The [Crystal Apothecary](entry://ink/crystal_apothecary)[#]() is able to harvest [#](bb00bb)Crystals[#]() automatically - even if you are not near those geodes at all!
Tools enchanted with [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance)[#]() are able to harvest Budding Blocks.
Scattered around the world you have discovered numerous geodes, which produce not only colored gems, but also valuable resources.
The [Crystal Apothecary](entry://ink/crystal_apothecary)[#]() is able to harvest [#](bb00bb)Crystals[#]() automatically - even if you are not near those geodes at all!
Tools enchanted with [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance)[#]() are able to harvest Budding Blocks.
This material seems ridiculously powerful at first glance for how common it is. That's why you gave it such a funny name. Let's see what you can do with it.
You are not going to believe this.
Fishing is a relaxing activity to do in your leisure time. Let's see what's biting today.

Your magical fishing rods are able to fish lava and end dwelling fish, like the Go Fish fishing rods.\
Crates can also be fished, as long as you are in the open.

While the Deepfry Enchantment cooks fish as usual, you did not find a way to attach lures to Rods made with Pigment. But you are sure you will find a way to enhance your rod later.\
Deepfry on Fishing Rods is also mutually exclusive to Foundry.

Unlike your other gemstones, [#](bb00bb)Amethyst[#]() seems to have the ability to power spell casting wands. While this ability has broken your brain more than once, the results are impressive.\
What more is there?
Hexcasters are seemingly unable to identify minerals other than Amethyst. *Clearly* these cyan-colored leaves have the essence of [#](bb00bb)Topaz[#]()...

By infusing [#](bb00bb)Leaves[#]() with [#](bb00bb)Amethyst[#](), [#](bb00bb)Citrine[#]() or [#](bb00bb)Topaz[#](), you get out glistening, colorful [#](bb00bb)Gemstone Leaves[#](), from your [Colored Trees](entry://general/colored_trees)[#](). Intriguingly different, yet familiar.
You can charge up [#](bb00bb)Amethyst Shards[#]() using the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine)[#]().

- +15-120s duration. Sometimes more, sometimes less\
\
As you expected, [#](bb00bb)Charged Amethyst[#]() serves as a more potent, but also more fluctuate, [#](bb00bb)Amethyst[#]() reagent in regards to prolonging durations.

These industrious little buggers continuously collect leaves from trees. The results of their work are also reflected in their products. While they mostly produce [#](449900)Clay[#](), there might be others...\
\
Shoutout to MastroCaleb for this great mod!
The ants produce an almost silk-like material from [#](bb00bb)Jade Petals[#]().
If you harvest a full anthill that collected leaves of colored trees with a shovel, you get [#](bb00bb)Dye[#]().
Even better, if you bribe them with [#](449900)Vegetal[#](), you can even salvage pure [#](449900)Pigment[#]() instead.
Scattered around the world you have discovered numerous geodes, which produce not only colored gems, but also valuable resources.
The [Crystal Apothecary](entry://ink/crystal_apothecary)[#]() is able to harvest [#](bb00bb)Crystals[#]() automatically - even if you are not near those geodes at all!
Tools enchanted with [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance)[#]() are able to harvest Budding Blocks.

Oh, so you're an Advancement Hunter with style!\
\
With Paginated Advancements installed, you will find that Spectrum's advancements use new, unique frames.
Marks the start and end of an advancement tree: major milestones in your journey.

Advancements using this slightly altered frame have some kind of unlock attached to them: new recipes, a new revelation or something else. (for all you completionists out there!)\
\
The default frame is used for advancements without additional unlocks.
Advancements using this frame show you that you have a new structure to build.
For affairs of heart, which require an extraordinary eye to detail.

Granted when doing something remarkably stupid.\
These are purely optional meme advancements without any unlocks.

Above the hemisphere of the Overworld exists a completely different kind of dimension: filled with numerous spheres that float away like small planets.\
\
You can reach them by building a portal from [#](bb00bb)Packed Ice[#]() (if it hasn't been changed by your modpack).

Here you will find numerous resources that are always hard to locate on the normal Overworld: spheres of gemstone, Spectrum's ores, and anything else your heart desires - unless you fall off a planet and plummet to your certain death.

*Still mining each ore individually? Gravity might make this easier.*\
\
Vein Mining rips out all connected blocks.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to all tools.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Vein Mining by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.
You took heart... and another and another. Now you've got a whole bunch of them. Exciting, huh.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pastel_network.c:
As the most basic of nodes the Connection Node does not have any use by itself.\
\
They solely act as a cheap and unobtrusive way to expand the range of your network.
As all other nodes, the Connection Node has a range of 12 blocks.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pastel_network.g:
The Gather Node will actively request from other nodes in its [Pastel Network](entry://pastel_network/pastel_network) and put them in its connected inventory.\
\
Specify the items to collect in its [#](449900)filter[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.pastel_network.p:
Your primitive ways of item transport like [#](449900)Hopper Arrays[#]() do not compare to the [#](449900)Pastel Network[#]() - this is what you named clusters of Azurite-based nodes.\
Placed in close proximity, nodes will connect wirelessly to one another and form an item transfer network.
The way nodes can interact with one another. They do not require line of sight.

Makes the items in the connected inventory available in its [Pastel Network](entry://pastel_network/pastel_network).\
\
Items will not be pushed to other nodes, but can be requested by [Gather Nodes](entry://pastel_network/gather_node).
book.spectrum.guidebook.pastel_network.r: When you expose a [#](bb00bb)Pastel Node[#]() to a [#](449900)redstone signal[#](), it loses its link to the connected inventory.

- [Gather Nodes](entry://pastel_network/gather_node) will stop requesting items
- [Provider Nodes](entry://pastel_network/provider_node) get unable to offer their items
- [Sender Nodes](entry://pastel_network/sender_node) will stop emptying their inventory
- [Storage Nodes](entry://pastel_network/storage_node) will get unable to accept and offer their items
book.spectrum.guidebook.pastel_network.s:
The Sender Node actively tries to keep the connected inventory empty from items.\
\
The order, in which it pushes items to, is as follows:
1. [Gather Nodes](entry://pastel_network/gather_node)
2. [Storage Nodes](entry://pastel_network/storage_node)

The Storage Node will show their greatest use in combination with [Sender Nodes](entry://pastel_network/sender_node) (will push to it) and [Gather Nodes](entry://pastel_network/gather_node) (will pull from it).\
\
Its [#](449900)filter[#]() allows you to specify which items it will receive & provide. An empty filter makes connected inventories act as a general storage for all types of items.
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone.name: Redstone Components
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone.block_b:
A simple way to destroy blocks. Neither the most sophisticated nor the most customisable, but it is easy to set up and very compact.\
\
Give it a Redstone signal to destroy the block in front of it.
Able to break blocks up to iron tier.
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone.block_d:
Almost like an [#](bb00bb)Observer[#](), but more specific.\
Gives off a [#](449900)redstone pulse[#]() every time a block is placed in front of it that matches the block below it (or above it, if facing down).
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone.block_p:
You are able to automatically break blocks, weight them, sort them or put them in one of your chests with ease. There is one thing that all your creative contraptions could never do: Place stuff. This is a thing of the past now.\
[Topaz](entry://general/shards@topaz), with its affinity to matter, lets you materialize blocks out of its inventory.
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone.ender_g:
You already thought the moment you put the recipe on paper that this creation will be something special.\
\
The combination of the power of [#](449900)The End[#](), [#](449900)Redstone[#]() and [#](449900)Magic[#]() gives it very strange properties.

Depending on the strength of the applied [#](449900)redstone signal[#](), this block takes on different properties:
- Without redstone, it is completely solid
- when a [#](449900)redstone signal[#]() reaches it, it becomes transparent, almost like glass
- however, it reaches its most curious state when a redstone signal of full strength is applied...

To make it even stranger, the material seems to respond to the last applied signal alone, not the strongest.\
\
Truly a curiosity from the End.
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone.entity_: The gemstone built into the Entity Detector reacts to micro-vibrations in the ground. This gives it the ability to measure the number of creatures near it.
Outputs a cumulative strength of 1 for each creature within a 10 block radius.
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone.item_de:
The Item Detector is used to count the items lying on the ground within a 10 block radius of it.\
\
The strength of the [#](449900)redstone signal[#]() depends on how many items are lying around.
64 items result in a signal with maximum strength.
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone.light_l:
[#](bb00bb)Daylight Detectors[#]() are imprecise when it comes to measuring light: the [#](bb00bb)Nether Quartz[#]() used is so crudely processed that only sunlight can trigger the detector reliably.\
Amethyst, shaped by a Pigment Pedestal, is much more sensitive when it comes to measuring light. Even the dim glow of a [#](bb00bb)Torch[#]() is sufficient to output decent strength.
The Light Level Detector does not only react to sunlight, but is also able to pick up other light sources, like light emitting blocks.
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone.player_:
You know people who build gigantic constructions out of [#](bb00bb)Redstone[#]() just to open an oversized door. And then they trigger it with an unsightly [#](bb00bb)Pressure Plate[#]().\
The Player Detector, on the other hand, is able to sense your presence - or that of other players - at a distance and sends out a corresponding [#](449900)redstone signal[#]().\
Much better.

Range: 10 blocks.\
Emits a full strength signal, if the player who placed it is detected, otherwise 8.
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone.redston: With the red math dust from the underground, you've built gigantic constructions several times, just to emulate a parrot's ability to calculate. When you look at these, your breath literally stops (and the rest of the world, too, multiple times a second). The energy laden [Citrine](entry://general/shards@citrine) seems like a perfect match for basic arithmetic logic.
Available modes: Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, Division, Modulo, Min and Max. First input is the back, second the highest signal on the sides.

Think back to the good old days when you would set little traps for your friends: if they touched the wrong block, they would be completely buried in sand. Now your friends are not so easily fooled.\
\
Modern problems require modern solutions.
Behaves like a solid block until it receives a [#](449900)redstone signal[#](). The [#](449900)redstone pulse[#]() propagates through all connected blocks and makes them fall.

Though there are lots of ways to calculate time, most seem relatively... rustic. They are no match for this new trick up your sleeve: the time-affinity of [Amethyst Shards](entry://general/shards@amethyst).
You can toggle the durations for both active time (interacting) and inactive time (sneak-interacting) with empty hand).

Gentle resonances are amplified by [Onyx](entry://general/shards@onyx) to such an extent that they can even be measured through walls, given a suitable receiver.\
Based on your previous experiments with gemstone shards, it was easy for you to devise such transmitter and receiver systems.
Use with empty hands to toggle sending/receiving. When in receiving mode, the output is directional. Change the frequency by using dye/pigment. Range: 16 blocks.
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone.weather:
Citrine is very sensitive to the energies released during a storm.\
\
If the Weather Detector is directly exposed to rain or a thunderstorm, it emits a [#](449900)redstone signal[#]().
Rain provides a signal with strength 8, thunderstorms of full 15.
A rich blue ore which, at a distance, can almost be mistaken for [#](bb00bb)Lapis[#](). In its natural form it contains many impurities which must first be removed before it can be used.\
\
It is found deep underground and seems to be able to intensify any Pigment's energy.

Refining Azurite is not a cheap task.\
In this refined ingot form Azurite can be used for many more recipes.
A metal that shimmers in all the colors of the rainbow.\
The small seedlings you collected are far too small to be used for any meaningful purpose.\
\
How do they grow without a budding block? One thing you noticed: it slightly grew in proximity of other metals.
Instead of sacrificing whole metal blocks, the [Crystallarieum](entry://ink/crystallarieum)[#]() provides a controlled substrate as well as a finer and more efficient way to provide nutrients.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.blood_or:
These leaves seem to belong to a flower you don't know. Did it once bloom here? Was it grown by those who came before you? Perhaps a souvenir from a world you have never entered yourself? Yet it looks like it was plucked just five minutes ago.\
You feel something whenever you touch the petal: *restlessness*.

[Resonant Lilies](entry://general/resonant_lily)! Truly an elusive flower - and seemingly related to Blood Orchids. Though the Blood Orchid's energy very quickly takes over.\
Welp, worst thing that can happen is you ending up with another plant that you can pluck petals off of.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.bloodsto:
The rather effulgent feathers of the [Kindlings](entry://creating_life/kindlings) are notable, enough so to compel you to regularly give the little bumpkins coat trimmings.\
However, you've noticed that, sadly quite frequently, drops of blood will come along with the feathers. Dipped in [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal)[#](), it leaves behind a sparkly, crystalline residue.

Set upon the crystallarieum and given a ***[#](ff3d71)precarious[#]()*** amount of [#](bb00bb)Copper[#](), the speck of dragonblood will grow and crystallize into a grand slab of glass, shining in stunning scarlet and bleeding with willful magic!
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.clover.p:
Plains and other green biomes are home to these lush green clovers, sprouting with life.\
\
*Is today your lucky day?*

Indeed it is!\
You are sure this tiny sign of luck could come in handy.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.geodes.p: Geodes form in places where magical energy is so abundant, it physically crystallizes.

\
Breaking Clusters gets you Gemstone Shards, which seem to inherit lots of the original magical properties.\
Each type of gemstone seems to represent a different type of fundamental property.\
\
Different heights promote formation of certain types. To find them all, it makes sense to search in different places.
The precious gemstones are protected by layers of [#](bb00bb)Calcite[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Basalt[#]().

Now that you are paying attention, you noticed small inclusions of gems in the rock all over the place.\
If you see such an ore a geode is surely not far!\
\
While not renewable like Gemstone Clusters, Gemstone Ore provides a lot of Shards, especially when broken with a Fortune-Tool.
Topaz geodes are gigantic in contrast to the others, fitting for their element of matter. However, for this they are found exclusively far above the ground in mountains or massive hills.

As elements of time, Amethyst Geodes tend to maintain their existence in the lowest layers of the world, quietly sealed off from all other happenings in the world.\
Leisurely and yet imposing.

Geodes with Citrine are found in the middle layers of the world, sometimes even accessible from the surface. These geodes are small, but harbor tremendous energy, so they are cracked especially often.

In the Deeper Down you stumbled upon Moonstone Geodes!\
You always suspected that there would be this other variant. Those often majestic geodes shine in the brightest of whites. Almost blinding, when accustomed to the darkness of the Deeper Down.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.jade_vin:
The remaining energy of this plant from aeons ago is barely still perceptible. So light and vulnerable that you think any wrong move could breathe the last bit of life out of your fragile bulb.\
\
*Will the history of this plant remain elusive to you forever?*

Once almost a lost cause, you now have an ace up your sleeve:\
With the help of the [Spirit Instiller](entry://creating_life/spirit_instiller) you are sure that you can breathe life back into the little bulb.

Pallid, fragile but nonetheless beautiful hanging plants, twining down wooden fences with generous space underneath.\
[#](8f2121)Not used to the intense light after all these aeons, they will die when exposed to too much sunlight.\
[#](5faa19)They only grow one stage per night and only when exposed to the far softer, indirect light of the moon.

As you exposed one of the plants to strong sunlight, you found that it withered. Not only did this withered shrub leave you with new Bulbs, but also this gel-like jelly.\
\
*Unexpectedly tasty*.

If the Jade Jelly is heated blazingly fast and then cooled down again, the result is a very viscous but sugar-sweet mass.\
\
*Fancy a sugar rush?*

Shiny petals can be plucked when partly grown.\
They can be used as decoration.\
Rarely, when searching the petals, [#](449900)another Bulb[#]() can be found. How will Jade Vines look when you let them grow further, tough?

After many nights on a full moon, the plants reach full bloom. The nectar that they collect in their blossoms can be harvested with a Glass Bottle.\
Bears great restorative properties:
- can be drunk for healing
- able to repair any damaged item[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.liquid_c:
Letting a full block of [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal)[#]() absorb the immense heat of [#](bb00bb)Lava[#]() resulted in this.\
Almost feels like a [#](bb00bb)Magma Block[#](), albeit way hotter.

Crushing [#](bb00bb)Blazing Crystal[#]() with an [#](bb00bb)Anvil[#](), gave you this burning hot essence that almost sets your hand on fire when you touch it. Crushing [#](bb00bb)Magma Blocks[#]() seems to work, too, albeit with far less yield.

As [#](bb00bb)Water[#]() tried to touch a full block of [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal)[#](), the crystal turned solid.\
Since even a light touch is enough to give you a cold shiver, you called it Frostbite Crystal.

Crushing [#](bb00bb)Frostbite Crystal[#]() with an [#](bb00bb)Anvil[#]() gave you this ice cold essence, which almost makes your hand freeze just by holding it. Crushing [#](bb00bb)Ice[#]() seems to work, too, albeit with far less yield.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.malachit: A pristine material that sparkles in a deep green hue. It seems to have strong magical properties, almost like a Deeper Down analog of [Azurite](entry://general/azurite)[#](). In another similarity to [Azurite](entry://general/azurite)[#](), Malachite also needs to be refined. The small fragments you obtain must first grow into full, usable crystals - though you're not sure you'll see them finished in your lifetime.

The Crystallarieum seems to be the only way for you to grow Malachite in a reasonable timeframe, by speeding up its growth significantly. [Moonstone](entry://general/moonstone_shards)[#]() is required to create a suitable environment, mimicking the Deeper Down.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.mermaids:
Mermaid's Brushes are inconspicuous plants that grow in the deepest depths of the oceans, forever untouched by human influence.\
\
They grow a single blossom, which slowly develops into a pearl-shaped seed. Fully grown, these hollow seeds float to the surface to be carried away by the soft waves.

Those seeds can be planted again, growing an additional plant.\
\
Mermaid's Gems have a strong bond with water - obviously.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.moonston:
This powerhouse of an item is able to funnel huge amounts of [#](d0d6d7)White Ink[#]() with ease. Can be used to boost the capabilities of equipment and devices.\
\
*A relic of times long gone*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.paltaeri:
The light blue color is the trademark of this ore. It is found exclusively in the End in small clusters.\
\
Like the End itself, the curious properties of this material are not to be overlooked.
Rarely, an intact gem can be carved out and used in recipes for which fragments are too small. With effort, said fragments can also be made whole again.
From your previous experiences with Paltaeria, you can already guess that it would not be a good idea to place this block in open sky - your future self will thank you.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.pure_res:
Growing materials in the [Crystallarieum](entry://ink/crystallarieum) yields this: a much more pure, crystalline variant compared to plain [#](bb00bb)Raw Ore[#]().\
\
On closer inspection they almost appear surrounded by an invisible sheen, gently protecting them from outside forces. This shroud also seems to be what protects [#](bb00bb)Pure Copper[#]() from oxidization.
Ironically, you found that these resources seemed to be able to withstand the heat of normal [#](bb00bb)Furnaces[#](). But you were able to smelt them in a [#](bb00bb)Blast Furnace[#](), at least.
However, smelting these in the [Cinderhearth](entry://ink/cinderhearth)[#]() yields a much more decent output.
Can be crafted back into [#](bb00bb)Pure Resources[#]().
It doesn't get much more efficient or risk-free than that.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.quitoxic: Grows exclusively in Swamps and seems to devour Clay as a form of nutrient.

A purple glittering powder can be extracted from the stems of the alien-looking plant by crushing it with an anvil.\
The smell and consistency are very unusual when rubbed between your fingers.\
\
*...wait a moment, what are fingers?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.radiatin:
Those pesky Endermen!\
\
They always show up at night and steal blocks off the ground right from your nose. You have a feeling this whole area will be nothing but a crater in a month.[#]()

The Endermen come to this world to place those blocks. But what is this stuff? And *WHY* do they leave it here?\
\
Now that you hold one in your hands... they are everywhere! How didn't you notice earlier? Anyways, you are sure that you can take advantage of this interesting material.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.shimmers:
A yellow ore that not only emits energy in the form of light, but is able to manipulate it, too.\
\
Shimmerstone is found close to sea level altitudes.
Full blocks of Shimmerstone emit glowing bright yellow particles.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.stargazi: The calmness of the night invites you to lie down in the grass and watch the stars.

The small Shooting Stars are made of a material unknown to you thus far.\
\
Can you catch one right out of the sky?\
\
*Tip: Shooting Stars are much easier to spot when using a Telescope or Night Vision.*

Now that you've collected all the variations, it's finally time to unwind! Hardened with a Diamond the Stars do not break anymore when hit.\
\
*Fancy a Starball tournament with your friends?*

Shooting Stars yield precious resources: a Star Fragment, Stardust and a whole lot of other rare materials.\
\
Picking up a Shooting Star by crouching and [smashing it via an Anvil](entry://general/item_crushing) will yield double the Star Fragments, albeit at the cost of the other materials.

A powder of unknown origin blessed with the soul of the stars.\
Bears coy, yet latent power.
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.storm_st:
Storms are a powerful manifestation of Mother Nature.\
Using the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine)[#]() you even started one when crafting [some powerful resources](entry://general/onyx_shards)[#]().\
\
There is no doubt that you will find something here to help you on your journey.

Dug into the ground by lightning strikes, you found these stones, vibrating in your hand due to barely-contained energy.\
Used in the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine)[#](), you can use them to summon thunderstorms with ease.\
\
*Because of their volatile nature, they do not react too nicely to explosions...*
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.stratine:
This very heavy ore is scattered around the depths of the Nether.\
It's probably not the best idea to carry large amounts of it home at once.
Rarely, an intact gem can be carved out and used in recipes for which fragments are too small. With effort, said fragments can also be made whole again.

Stratine - as you may have already noticed - is an exceptionally heavy material. And difficult to shape, too. Even the blazing heat of the Nether could not harm the material.\
\
However, shaping it via your [Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal)[#]() should not be a problem whatsoever.
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.cr:
My whole "creating life" thing has had mixed results so far. But I'm starting to feel confident that I can achieve *something*.\
\
Creating life from nothing is a difficult thing, but combining existing knowledge?\
\
Is that how Frankenstein felt? *Does this make me bad? Evil? I am not at all sure, but I am very much willing to try.*
Works for every color of Axolotl.
Works for every color of Parrot.
Works for every color of Shulker.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.primor: Much more aggressive than common [#](bb00bb)Fire[#]() started by [#](bb00bb)Flint & Steel[#](), the [#](bb00bb)Primordial Fire[#]() started by Doomblooms seems to burn with an insatiable, blazing heat. almost as consuming matter and souls alike.
Primordial Fire does not seem to draw its energy primarily from matter, but rather burns the soul.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_items.pr:
[Primordial Fire](entry://dimension/primordial_fire)[#]() is the devil's stuff. No wonder it eats away at your soul.\
\
Without this glove, I would be very uncomfortable. - *I actually quite like my soul*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magical_blocks.c:
Growing resources requires:
- a starter bud thrown in
- catalysts thrown in
- a specific color of Ink, supplied via [Flask](entry://ink/ink_flask)[#]()
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.resonant_l: In [Crystal Gardens](entry://dimension/crystal_gardens), flowers that grow near [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal) have strange characteristics. Has their proximity to the liquid changed them?.
I don't have that much time to grow a whole new plant like that. But what if I simply throw an existing plant into the liquid to speed up the process?
book.spectrum.guidebook.general.color_mi:
\
\
\
The blackness of Onyx allows me a few more combinations. Still not perfect, but fantastic progress!\
\
What about grey tones? Maybe I'll come up with another idea...

\
\
**It's incredible!**\
\
Seeing the full colour spectrum after such a long, arduous journey and many failures makes my heart happy. I can't wait to see what creative innovations will flow through my brush next.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.excava:
Looks like whoever came before you was able to harvest Downstone! But only with the help of colossal, imposing drills.\
\
It seems like they used it to manufacture [#](bb00bb)Preservation Stone[#]()?
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.weathe:
I would like to note one observation:\
Not only does the environment have an influence on the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine), I have also noticed that the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine) has an influence on its surroundings!\
\
With the right combination of materials, I can influence the weather.
Modular tools were always a field I was interested in. Let's see what I can come up with to make my life easier.
The [Crystal Apothecary](entry://ink/crystal_apothecary)[#]() is able to harvest [#](bb00bb)Crystals[#]() automatically - even if you are not near those geodes at all!
Tools enchanted with [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance)[#]() are able to harvest Budding Blocks.

There is this new thing, called *Electricity*, I should check that out.\
\
The factory must grow.
The Cinderhearth is great at creating Refined Iron! What a little more heat can do.
I can process most of my magical ores in the Grinder and Industrial Grinder.

Of course I can also grind down Shards, too!\
\
*I hate grind in games*
Rock Crystal is a great source of Silicon
advancements.spectrum.craft_energy_colle: Construct a collector powerful enough to harvest energy from a geodes
advancements.spectrum.place_energy_colle: Place the collector in the center of a geode and watch it work
advancements.spectrum.unused2.title: Having a Blast
advancements.spectrum.defeat_paintlich.d: Win a light-hearted discussion with an Aging Celebrity
